voca.means_ko:
[^풰일류어r]
실패, 실수, 부족
실패자, 실패작
~ 하지 않음. ~불이행
고장, (기업의) 도산
voca.means_en:
Failure is a lack of success in doing or achieving something, especially in relation to a particular activity.
If something is a failure, it is not a success.
If you say that someone is a failure, you mean that they have not succeeded in a particular activity, or that they are unsuccessful at everything they do.
Your failure to do a particular thing is the fact that you do not do it, even though you were expected to do it.
If there is a failure of something, for example a machine or part of the body, it goes wrong and stops working or developing properly.
If there is a failure of a business or bank, it is no longer able to continue operating.
to go or pass very quickly; to go very quickly past somebody/something\n

voca.means_ko: [플^뤄-뤠s]\n흠없는, 완벽한, 흠이 없는, 결점 없는\n나무랄 데 없는
voca.means_en: If you say that something or someone is flawless, you mean that they are extremely good and that there are no faults or problems with them.\n
A flea market is an outdoor market which sells cheap used goods and sometimes also very old furniture.\n

voca.means_ko:
[^플릐벡]
초라한 공공건물, 싸구려 여인숙
더러운 몰골(을 한 사람)
지저분한 짐승
voca.means_en: a dirty or unkempt person\na cheap or dirty hotel\n

voca.means_ko:
~을 데리러/가지러 가다,
~을 좋아하다, 찬성하다,
~을 얻으려고 애쓰다
~에 해당되다.
voca.means_en:
choose / select / pick / opt / go for / single out
to attack somebody/something
to apply to somebody/something; to be true of somebody/something
to go to get somebody/something
to be attracted by somebody/something; to like or prefer somebody/something
Lisa: Then where can I go for this service?
She makes a fuss about her weight most of the time.\n
pay / foot the bill / pick up the bill / tab\n

voca.means_ko:
[^뤠인쥐]
(특정 종류에 속하는 사물들의) 다양성
(변화, 차이의) 범위, 폭
(특정 종류의 상품) 세트
(눈으로 보거나 귀로 들을 수 있는) 거리, 범위
(총 등의) 사정거리, 사격 연습장
산맥, 산줄기
(양, 크기 등의 범위가) A에서 B 사이이다
A에서 B까지 다양하다
(사람들, 사물들을) 배열/배치하다
(이리저리) 돌아다니다, 배회하다
voca.means_en:
A range of things is a number of different things of the same general kind.
A range is the complete group that is included between two points on a scale of measurement or quality.
The range of something is the maximum area in which it can reach things or detect things.
A range of mountains or hills is a line of them.
A rifle range or a shooting range is a place where people can practise shooting at targets.
A range or kitchen range is an old-fashioned metal cooker.
A range or kitchen range is a large metal device for cooking food using gas or electricity. A range consists of a grill, an oven, and some gas or electric rings.
If things range between two points or range from one point to another, they vary within these points on a scale of measurement or quality.
If something is in range or within range, it is near enough to be reached or detected. If it is out of range, it is too far away to be reached or detected.
If you see or hit something at close range or from close range, you are very close to it when you see it or hit it. If you do something at a range of half a mile, for example, you are half a mile away from it when you do it.
Seller: What price range do you have in mind?

voca.means_ko:
[^에듀뤠s]
주소, 인사말, 연설, 
(편지봉투에) 주소를 쓰다
연설하다, 호칭을 쓰다, 호칭을 부르다
voca.means_en:
speech / lecture / address / talk / sermon
Your address is the number of the house, flat, or apartment and the name of the street and the town where you live or work.
If a letter, envelope, or parcel is addressed to you, your name and address have been written on it.
If you address a group of people, you give a speech to them.
If you address someone or address a remark to them, you say something to them.
If you address a problem or task or if you address yourself to it, you try to understand it or deal with it.

voca.means_ko:
[콕k]
숫탉, (새의) 숫컷, 
(수도, 가스의) 고동/꼭지
(총의) 공이치기를 당겨 세우다, 
(귀, 꼬리 등을) 곧추 세우다
voca.means_en:
A cock is an adult male chicken.
You refer to a male bird, especially a male game bird, as a cock when you want to distinguish it from a female bird.
His head was cocked to one side.
He cocked his head from side to side, listening.

voca.means_ko: (학교, 극장이 )끝나다, 파하다, 누설하다, \n내다, 지르다\n(수업, 회의, 영화 상영 등이) 끝나다
voca.means_en:
when schools, classes, offices, etc. let out, they come to an end and students, workers, etc. go home at the end of a day or a term
But just then the mammoth let out a cry.
He let out a deep breat, then he pushed his glasses into place.
Arthur let out a sigh.
She reached out her hand.\nShe reached out for a closer look. "What does it say? Is it sealed?"\n

voca.means_ko:
[^씨일]
바다표범, 물개, 
인감, 도장, 봉인
봉인하다, 밀폐하다, 도장을 찍다
voca.means_en:
When you seal an envelope, you close it by folding part of it over and sticking it down, so that it cannot be opened without being torn.
If you seal a container or an opening, you cover it with something in order to prevent air, liquid, or other material getting in or out. If you seal something in a container, you put it inside and then close the container tightly.
If someone in authority seals an area, they stop people entering or passing through it, for example by placing barriers in the way.
To seal something means to make it definite or confirm how it is going to be.
The seal on a container or opening is the part where it has been sealed.
A seal is a device or a piece of material, for example in a machine, which closes an opening tightly so that air, liquid, or other substances cannot get in or out.
A seal is something such as a piece of sticky paper or wax that is fixed to a container or door and must be broken before the container or door can be opened.
She reached out for a closer look. "What does it say? Is it sealed?"

voca.means_ko:
[s^테일]
신선하지 않은, (만든지) 오래 된,
퀴퀴한, (좋지 못한) 냄새가 나는, 
김빠진, 상한, 활력이 없는
(사람이 같은 일을 너무 오래해서) 생산성이 떨어지는
voca.means_en:
Stale food is no longer fresh or good to eat.
Stale air or a stale smells is unpleasant because it is no longer fresh.
If you say that a place, an activity, or an idea is stale, you mean that it has become boring because it is always the same.

voca.means_ko:
[s^퇄]
(특히 시장의) 가판대, 좌판, 
(농장 건물안의) 마구간, 외양간, 
(방 안에 칸막이를 해서 만든) 샤워실/화장실
(차량, 엔진이) 멎다, (갑자기) 시동이 꺼지다
교착상태에 빠뜨리다, 지연시키다.
voca.means_en:
If a process stalls, or if someone or something stalls it, the process stops but may continue at a later time.
If you stall, you try to avoid doing something until later.
If you stall someone, you prevent them from doing something until a later time.
If a vehicle stalls or if you accidentally stall it, the engine stops suddenly.
A stall is a large table on which you put goods that you want to sell, or information that you want to give people.
The stalls in a theatre or concert hall are the seats on the ground floor directly in front of the stage.
in AM, use orchestra
A stall is a small enclosed area in a room which is used for a particular purpose, for example a shower.
in BRIT, usually use cubicle
There were rows of clean, empty stalls.

voca.means_ko:
[s^탈워r-t]
몸집이 건장한 사람
건장한, 튼튼한, 힘세고 용감한
충실한, 충직한
voca.means_en: A stalwart is a loyal worker or supporter of an organization, especially a political party.\nA stalwart supporter or worker is loyal, steady, and completely reliable.\n
If you stammer, you speak with difficulty, hesitating and repeating words or sounds.\nSomeone who has a stammer tends to stammer when they speak.\n

voca.means_ko:
[s^뗌p]
우표, 수입인지, 스탬프
도장, 특징, 흔적
(땅/바닥을) 짓밟다, 밟아 소리나게 하다, 구르다
우표를 붙이다, (도장을) 찍다
voca.means_en:
A stamp or a postage stamp is a small piece of paper which you lick and stick on an envelope or package before you post it to pay for the cost of the postage.
A stamp is a small block of wood or metal which has a pattern or a group of letters on one side. You press it onto an pad of ink and then onto a piece of paper in order to produce a mark on the paper. The mark that you produce is also called a stamp.
If something bears the stamp of a particular quality or person, it clearly has that quality or was done by that person.
If you stamp a mark or word on an object, you press the mark or word onto the object using a stamp or other device.
In the gray light, they stamped the snow off their sneakers.
An abbreviation is a short form of a word or phrase, made by leaving out some of the letters or by using only the first letter of each word.\nWhat's the abbreviation for 'Saint'?\n
The abductor did not demand a ransom.\nShe says the artist's impression is an excellent likeness of her abductor.\n
If one person abets another, they help or encourage them to do something criminal or wrong. Abet is often used in the legal expression 'aid and abet'.\n
If a woman has an abortion, she ends her pregnancy deliberately so that the baby is not born alive.\nWhat are your views on abortion? / We'd like to know what you feel about abortion.\n
Someone's absence from a place is the fact that they are not there.\nThe absence of something from a place is the fact that it is not there or does not exist.\n

An abstract idea or way of thinking is based on general ideas rather than on real things and events.
In grammar, an abstract noun refers to a quality or idea rather than to a physical object.
Abstract art makes use of shapes and patterns rather than showing people or things.
Don't most people think philosophy is too abstract for them?
I read the abstract at the meeting.
This is the abstract of the presentation.

She acepted my apology.
She was so angry that she didn't accept his apology.
Do you think he will accept my apology?

If you accomplish something, you succeed in doing it.
She accomplished her mission for the lifting of a finger.
She has accomplished much in her short career. / I don't know what they accomplished.
He accomplished what was considered unthinkable.

true / right / correct / exact / precise / accurate / spot on
Accurate information, measurements, and statistics are correct to a very detailed level. An accurate instrument is able to give you information of this kind.
An accurate statement or account gives a true or fair judgment of something.
You can use accurate to describe the results of someone's actions when they do or copy something correctly or exactly.
An accurate weapon or throw reaches the exact point or target that it was intended to reach. You can also describe a person as accurate if they fire a weapon or throw something in this way.

If you accuse someone of doing something wrong or dishonest, you say or tell them that you believe that they did it.
If you are accused of a crime, a witness or someone in authority states or claims that you did it, and you may be formally charged with it and put on trial.
I don't want to accuse them. / I didn't accuse him of anything.
Terry: Okay. I studied very hard. I think I did okay. I don't know why I'm so worried. I hope I aced it.\n

If you achieve a particular aim or effect, you succeed in doing it or causing it to happen, usually after a lot of effort.
There's no easy way to achieve one's aim.
We have achieved what we intended to achieve.

voca.means_ko:
[엑k^놀릐쥐]
~을 (사실로) 인정하다, ~에 동의하다
(호의, 칭찬등에) 감사하다, 감사의 뜻을 표하다
(서신·선물 등을) 받았음을 알리다
voca.means_en:
admit / acknowledge / concede / confess / allow / grant
If you acknowledge a fact or a situation, you accept or admit that it is true or that it exists.
If someone's achievements, status, or qualities are acknowledged, they are known about and recognized by a lot of people, or by a particular group of people.
If you acknowledge a message or letter, you write to the person who sent it in order to say that you have received it.
If you acknowledge someone, for example by moving your head or smiling, you show that you have seen and recognized them.

If you acquire something, you buy or obtain it for yourself, or someone gives it to you.
If you acquire something such as a skill or a habit, you learn it, or develop it through your daily life or experience.
Work hard while you're young and acquire a competence.
Children acquire a foreign language rapidly.

An acronym is a word composed of the first letters of the words in a phrase, especially when this is used as a name. An example of an acronym is NATO which is made up of the first letters of the 'North Atlantic Treaty Organization'.
The Rising SUV. SUV is an acronym for sport-utility vehicle.
The word "acronym" was coined for curtailing words.

voca.means_ko: [액t]\n행동, 법률, (연극) 막\n행동하다, 적용하다, ~처럼 행동하다, 가장하다, 연기하다
voca.means_en:
action / move / act / gesture / deed / feat
When you act, you do something for a particular purpose.
If you act on advice or information, you do what has been advised or suggested.
If someone acts in a particular way, they behave in that way.
If someone or something acts as a particular thing, they have that role or function.
An act is a single thing that someone does.
If you say that someone's behaviour is an act, you mean that it does not express their real feelings.

Someone who is active moves around a lot or does a lot of things.
If you have an active mind or imagination, you are always thinking of new things.
If someone is active in an organization, cause, or campaign, they do things for it rather than just giving it their support.
If you say that a person or animal is active in a particular place or at a particular time, you mean that they are performing their usual activities or performing a particular activity.
You're just copying word for word, you're not actually doing anything active with the material you're listening to. So, working with a computer-and I've seen this in my university-a lot of students also end up going on Facebook during the lesson or lecture. So, a lot of  the times they get very distracted. When they should be listening, they're actually not.

So, for people who like to take notes by computer, there are some advantages of this. You're able to type really quickly and you're able to get  a lot of what you hear down on your computer, and it's easy to save. But the problem with  this is it's a type of passive listening. So, a lot of the times you're not actually using your brain to interpret what you're listening to, and you're not actively listening.\n
An actor is someone whose job is acting in plays or films. 'Actor' in the singular usually refers to a man, but some women who act prefer to be called 'actors' rather than 'actresses'.\n

Acupuncture is the treatment of a person's illness or pain by sticking small needles into their body at certain places.
Acupuncture appears to be effective in relieving pain.
Dr. George Lewith has studied acupuncture for 25 years.

voca.means_ko:
[어큐웃t]
극심한,  심각한, 절실한
(질병이) 급성의
(관찰력, 이해력 등이) 예리한,
(각도가) 예각인
voca.means_en:
You can use acute to indicate that an undesirable situation or feeling is very severe or intense.
An acute illness is one that becomes severe very quickly but does not last very long. Compare chronic.
If a person's or animal's sight, hearing, or sense of smell is acute, it is sensitive and powerful.
An acute angle is less than 90. Compare obtuse angle.
I need the help of an acute man such as you. / There is an acute shortage of water.

voca.means_ko:
[어^답t]
(새로운 용도, 상황에) 맞추다, 조정하다, 
(상황에) 적응하다, ~을 적응시키다, 
변경하다, 각색하다
voca.means_en:
If you adapt to a new situation or adapt yourself to it, you change your ideas or behaviour in order to deal with it successfully.
If you adapt something, you change it to make it suitable for a new purpose or situation.
If you adapt a book or play, you change it so that it can be made into a film or a television programme.
I don't know if I can adapt to the pressure. / I don't know how to adapt this.
You have to adapt yourself to your new circumstances.
An adjective is a word such as 'big', 'dead', or 'financial' that describes a person or thing, or gives extra information about them. Adjectives usually come before nouns or after link verbs.\n
An admiral is a higher rank than a captain in the navy.\nAnd 23 is the number of Admiral Yi's consecutive victories.\n

voca.means_ko: [어^둽t]\n입양하다, 채택하다, 도입/적용하다\n(이름, 국가, 제도 등을) 택하다, 취하다, 선정하다
voca.means_en: If you adopt a new attitude, plan, or way of behaving, you begin to have it.\nIf you adopt someone else's child, you take it into your own family and make it legally your son or daughter.\n

voca.means_ko: [에d^벤티쥐]\n(누구에게) 유리한 점, 이점, 장점, \n이익, 우위, 혜택
voca.means_en:
An advantage is something that puts you in a better position than other people.
Advantage is the state of being in a better position than others who are competing against you.
An advantage is a way in which one thing is better than another.
If you take advantage of something, you make good use of it while you can.
If someone takes advantage of you, they treat you unfairly for their own benefit, especially when you are trying to be kind or to help them.
If you use or turn something to your advantage, you use it in order to benefit from it, especially when it might be expected to harm or damage you.
So, for people who like to take notes by computer, there are some advantages of this. You're able to type really quickly and you're able to get  a lot of what you hear down on your computer, and it's easy to save. But the problem with  this is it's a type of passive listening. So, a lot of the times you're not actually  using your brain to interpret what you're listening to, and you're not actively listening.
An adverb is a word such as 'slowly', 'now', 'very', 'politically', or 'fortunately' which adds information about the action, event, or situation mentioned in a clause.\n

voca.means_ko: [에s^떼릑]\n심미적, 미학적, 미적인, 미를 살려 만든\n미학, 미적 가치관, (특정 시대, 장소의) 미학 이론
voca.means_en: Aesthetic is used to talk about beauty or art, and people's appreciation of beautiful things.\n

voca.means_ko: [어풰어r]\n(공식적으로 중요하거나 관심사가 되는) 일, 문제, \n사건, 정사, 행사
voca.means_en:
If an event or a series of events has been mentioned and you want to talk about it again, you can refer to it as the affair.
You can refer to an important or interesting event or situation as 'the ... affair'.
You can describe the main quality of an event by saying that it is a particular kind of affair.
You can describe an object as a particular kind of affair when you want to draw attention to a particular feature, or indicate that it is unusual.
The paper reports the affair in full. / I've had a lifetime love affair with mechanical things.

voca.means_ko:
[어풱t]
~에 영향을 미차다, 감동시키다
(사람이나 신체 부위에) 발생하다/침범하다, 
병이나게 하다
(옷 차림, 어투를) 꾸미다, 과장되게 입다/쓰다
감정, 정서
voca.means_en:
affect / effect
If something affects a person or thing, it influences them or causes them to change in some way.
If a disease affects someone, it causes them to become ill.
If something or someone affects you, they make you feel a strong emotion, especially sadness or pity.
It doesn't seem to affect you. / I didn't realize how much it would affect me.

voca.means_ko:
[어^포r-d]
(~할, 살, 금전적, 시간적) 여유가 되다, 형편이 되다
~하면 안 되다
제공하다
voca.means_en:
If you cannot afford something, you do not have enough money to pay for it.
If you say that you cannot afford to do something or allow it to happen, you mean that you must not do it or must prevent it from happening because it would be harmful or embarrassing to you.
If someone or something affords you an opportunity or protection, they give it to you.
I can't afford the money to go out with you.

afraid / frightened / scared / alarmed / paranoid / apprehensive
If you are afraid of someone or afraid to do something, you are frightened because you think that something very unpleasant is going to happen to you.
If you are afraid for someone else, you are worried that something horrible is going to happen to them.
If you are afraid that something unpleasant will happen, you are worried that it may happen and you want to avoid it.
If you want to apologize to someone or to disagree with them in a polite way, you can say I'm afraid.
"No," Jack said, afraid to get his hopes up.
They huddled together, afraid to leave and afraid to stay.

used to show that something is the opposite of what you first intend to do or expect to happen
used when you are explaining something or giving a reason
Maybe third grade wasn't so bad after all.
The afternoon is the part of each day which begins at lunchtime and ends at about six o'clock.\nSunlight had faded from the late-afternoon sky.\n

Will it not come to the same thing if I pay afterward?
In the days afterward, the U.N.
We'd both like water and afterward we'll have coffee.

An agent is a person who looks after someone else's business affairs or does business on their behalf.
An agent in the arts world is a person who gets work for an actor or musician, or who sells the work of a writer to publishers.
An agent is a person who works for a country's secret service.
A chemical that has a particular effect or is used for a particular purpose can be referred to as a particular kind of agent.

An aggressive person or animal has a quality of anger and determination that makes them ready to attack other people.
People who are aggressive in their work or other activities behave in a forceful way because they are very eager to succeed.
He gets aggressive when he's drunk.
A good salesperson has to be aggressive in today's competitive market

We'll just have to move out a little more aggressively.
He drives aggressively.
Or you can treat it aggressively, which is by surgery.

voca.means_ko: [어^헷d]\n(공간, 시간상으로) 앞으로, 앞에, \n앞쪽으로, 앞서서, 장차, 미리,
voca.means_en:
Something that is ahead is in front of you. If you look ahead, you look directly in front of you.
You use ahead with verbs such as 'push', 'move', and 'forge' to indicate that a plan, scheme, or organization is making fast progress.
If you are ahead in your work or achievements, you have made more progress than you expected to and are performing well.
If a person or a team is ahead in a competition, they are winning.
Ahead also means in the future.
If you prepare or plan something ahead, you do it some time before a future event so that everything is ready for that event to take place.

voca.means_ko:
[^에어r]
공기, 대기, 공중, 허공, 
(비행기가 나는) 하늘/공중, 항공, 
(독특한) 느낌/인상, 태도
곡조, 선율, 
(옷 등에) 바람/햇볕을 쬐다, 
(바람이 통하는 곳에서) 말리다, 환기시키다, 
방송하다, 방송되다
voca.means_en:
Air is the mixture of gases which forms the earth's atmosphere and which we breathe.
The air is the space around things or above the ground.
Air is used to refer to travel in aircraft.
If you say that someone or something has a particular air, you mean that they give this general impression.
If you say that someone is putting on airs or giving themselves airs, you are criticizing them for behaving as if they are better than other people.
If a broadcasting company airs a television or radio programme, they show it on television or broadcast it on the radio.
If you air your opinions, you make them known to people.
If you air a room or building, you let fresh air into it.
If you air clothing or bedding, you put it somewhere warm to make sure that it is completely dry.
The car is packed and we're all set to go on our vacation.\nEddie: That's too early. We have everything packed already. We're all set to go.\n

voca.means_ko: [얼라이]\n~을 동맹시키다, 결연하다, 지지하다, 편들다\n동맹국, 연합국, 협력자
voca.means_en:
A country's ally is another country that has an agreement to support it, especially in war.
The Allies were the armed forces that fought against Germany and Japan in the Second World War.
If you describe someone as your ally, you mean that they help and support you, especially when other people are opposing you.
If you ally yourself with someone or something, you give your support to them.
I will have a mighty ally. / The politician tried to make an ally of the people.

voca.means_ko: [얼렁]\n~을 (죽, 계속) 따라, ~과 나란히, 앞쪽으로, 계속\n앞으로, ~ 와 함께, 진척되어
voca.means_en:
If you move or look along something such as a road, you move or look towards one end of it.
If something is situated along a road, river, or corridor, it is situated in it or beside it.
You use along with to mention someone or something else that is also involved in an action or situation.
When someone or something moves along, they keep moving in a particular direction.
If you say that something is going along in a particular way, you mean that it is progressing in that way.
They walked slowly along the road. / Houses had been built along both sides of the river.
We're going for a swim. Why don't you come along?
Along the brilliant crystal walls of the room were four doorways.

already / just / yet\nYou use already to show that a situation exists at this present moment or that it exists at an earlier time than expected. You use already after the verb 'be' or an auxiliary verb, or before a verb if there is no auxiliary. When you want add emphasis, you can put already at the beginning of a sentence.\n
An ambassador is an important official who lives in a foreign country and represents his or her own country's interests there.\n

to add up to something; to result in a final total of something
to be equal to or the same as something
if you say that somebody/something doesn't amount to much, you mean that he/she/it is not very important
If there is an ample amount of something, there is enough of it and usually some extra.\nMr. Franklin: You'll have ample opportunity to take the class.\n
To amputate someone's arm or leg means to cut all or part of it off in an operation because it is diseased or badly damaged.\nThe doctors decided not to amputate his legs.\n

Anatomy is the study of the structure of the bodies of people or animals.
You can refer to your body as your anatomy.
An animal's anatomy is the structure of its body.

Angels are spiritual beings that some people believe are God's servants in heaven.
You can call someone you like very much an angel in order to show affection, especially when they have been kind to you or done you a favour.
If you describe someone as an angel, you mean that they seem to be very kind and good.
A male deer's antlers are the branched horns on its head.\nHis huge antlers seemed to glow in the cold moonlight.\n

voca.means_ko:
[엥셧s]
불안해 하는, 염려하는, 
걱정스러운, 불안한, 염려하는, 
열망하는, 갈망하는, 간절히 바라는
voca.means_en:
worried / concerned / nervous / anxious / uneasy
If you are anxious to do something or anxious that something should happen, you very much want to do it or very much want it to happen.
If you are anxious, you are nervous or worried about something.
An anxious time or situation is one during which you feel nervous and worried.
Mindy: No I'm just anxious to hear what it is you want to tell me.

voca.means_ko:
[에입]
유인원
(무엇을 재대로 하지 못하고) 겨우 흉내만 내다
(웃기려고) 흉내내다
voca.means_en: Apes are chimpanzees, gorillas, and other animals in the same family.\nIf you ape someone's speech or behaviour, you imitate it.\n
When you apologize to someone, you say that you are sorry that you have hurt them or caused trouble for them. You can say 'I apologize' as a formal way of saying sorry.\n

An apology is something that you say or write in order to tell someone that you are sorry that you have hurt them or caused trouble for them.
If you offer or make your apologies, you apologize.
She acepted my apology.
She was so angry that she didn't accept his apology.
Do you think he will accept my apology?

An apostrophe is the mark ' when it is written to indicate that one or more letters have been left out of a word, as in 'isn't' and 'we'll'. It is also added to nouns to form possessives, as in 'Mike's car'.\n

You use apparently to indicate that the information you are giving is something that you have heard, but you are not certain that it is true.
You use apparently to refer to something that seems to be true, although you are not sure whether it is or not.
B : Apparently, something has come up and she couldn't come.

When someone makes an appearance at a public event or in a broadcast, they take part in it.
Someone's or something's appearance is the way that they look.
The appearance of someone or something in a place is their arrival there, especially when it is unexpected.
The appearance of something new is its coming into existence or use.
If something has the appearance of a quality, it seems to have that quality.
If something is true to all appearances, from all appearances, or by all appearances, it seems from what you observe or know about it that it is true.

Your appetite is your desire to eat.
Someone's appetite for something is their strong desire for it.
I just lost my appetite.

When a group of people applaud, they clap their hands in order to show approval, for example when they have enjoyed a play or concert.
When an attitude or action is applauded, people praise it.
Your appetite is your desire to eat. / Someone's appetite for something is their strong desire for it.

An apprentice is a young person who works for someone in order to learn their skill.
If a young person is apprenticed to someone, they go to work for them in order to learn their skill.
Their helper was the young sorcerer who was training as Morgan's apprentice!
Someone's aptitude for a particular kind of work or activity is their ability to learn it quickly and to do it well.\n

An area is a particular part of a town, a country, a region, or the world.
Your area is the part of a town, country, or region where you live. An organization's area is the part of a town, country, or region that it is responsible for.
A particular area is a piece of land or part of a building that is used for a particular activity.
An area is a particular place on a surface or object, for example on your body.
The area of a surface such as a piece of land is the amount of flat space or ground that it covers, measured in square units.
You can use area to refer to a particular subject or topic, or to a particular part of a larger, more general situation or activity.

voca.means_ko:
[^아r-규-]
(논거를 들어) 주장/논쟁하다, 말다툼하다
언쟁하다, 다투다
분명히 보여주다, 입증하다
voca.means_en:
If one person argues with another, they speak angrily to each other about something that they disagree about.
If you tell someone not to argue with you, you want them to do or believe what you say without protest or disagreement.
If you argue with someone about something, you discuss it with them, with each of you giving your different opinions.
If you argue that something is true, you state it and give the reasons why you think it is true.
If you argue for something, you say why you agree with it, in order to persuade people that it is right. If you argue against something, you say why you disagree with it, in order to persuade people that it is wrong.
If you argue, you support your opinions with evidence in an ordered or logical way.
If you say that no-one can argue with a particular fact or opinion, you are emphasizing that it is obviously true and so everyone must accept it.
Paul: What did you argue about?

voca.means_ko:
[어롸운d]
약, ~ 쯤,
사방에서, 빙 둘러, 
굴러서, 둘레(수치가) ~인,
이리저리, 여기저기, 하릴없이
주변에 있는, 마련할 수 있는,
둘레에, 주위에, 둥굴게, 빙 돌아
voca.means_en:
around / round / about
To be positioned around a place or object means to surround it or be on all sides of it. To move around a place means to go along its edge, back to your starting point.
If you move around a corner or obstacle, you move to the other side of it. If you look around a corner or obstacle, you look to see what is on the other side.
If you move around a place, you travel through it, going to most of its parts. If you look around a place, you look at every part of it.
If someone moves around a place, they move through various parts of that place without having any particular destination.
You use around to say that something happens in different parts of a place or area.
The people around you are the people who you come into contact with, especially your friends and relatives, and the people you work with.
If something such as a film, a discussion, or a plan is based around something, that thing is its main theme.
When you are giving measurements, you can use around to talk about the distance along the edge of something round.
If you turn around, you turn so that you are facing in the opposite direction.
If you go around to someone's house, you visit them.
You use around in expressions such as sit around and hang around when you are saying that someone is spending time in a place and not doing anything very important.
If you move things around, you move them so that they are in different places.
You use around in expressions such as this time around or to come around when you are describing something that has happened before or things that happen regularly.
The villagers gathered around.
Arthritis is a medical condition in which the joints in someone's body are swollen and painful.\n

voca.means_ko:
[아-뤼끌]
(신물, 잡지의) 글, 기사, 
(합의서, 계약서의) 조항, 
~을 고발하다
기사, 조항, 관사
voca.means_en:
An article is a piece of writing that is published in a newspaper or magazine.
You can refer to objects as articles of some kind.
An article of a formal agreement or document is a section of it which deals with a particular point.
Someone who is in articles is being trained as a lawyer or accountant by a firm with whom they have a written agreement.
In grammar, an article is a kind of determiner. In English, 'a' and 'an' are called the indefinite article, and 'the' is called the definite article.
If you describe something as the genuine article, you are emphasizing that it is genuine, and often that it is very good.

voca.means_ko:
[^에s]
~ 처럼, 같이
(가격, 기능 등이) ~ 로서
~만큼 ~ 한
~하는 것과 같이, ~ 듯이
~하는 동안에
~대로
voca.means_en:
If something happens as something else happens, it happens at the same time.
You use as to say how something happens or is done, or to indicate that something happens or is done in the same way as something else.
You use as to introduce short clauses which comment on the truth of what you are saying.
You can use as to mean 'because' when you are explaining the reason for something.
You use the structure as...as when you are comparing things.
You use as...as to emphasize amounts of something.
You say as it were in order to make what you are saying sound less definite.
You use expressions such as as it is, as it turns out, and as things stand when you are making a contrast between a possible situation and what actually happened or is the case.
You use as when you are indicating what someone or something is or is thought to be, or what function they have.
If you do something as a child or as a teenager, for example, you do it when you are a child or a teenager.
You use as in expressions like as a result and as a consequence to indicate how two situations or events are related to each other.
You use as for and as to at the beginning of a sentence in order to introduce a slightly different subject that is still connected to the previous one.
You use as to to indicate what something refers to.
If you say that something will happen as of, or in British English as from, a particular date or time, you mean that it will happen from that time on.
Just as before, the dancers didn't seem to notice.\n

I'm as blind as a bat.
When the lights went out. She was as blind as a bat.
He can't be a pilot because he is as blind as a bat.
His arms felt as if they were being pulled out of their sockets.\nIt had wings that looked as if they'd been spun from a thousand spiderwebs.\n

Ash is the grey or black powdery substance that is left after something is burnt. You can also refer to this substance as ashes.
A dead person's ashes are their remains after their body has been cremated.
An ash is a tree that has smooth grey bark and loses its leaves in winter.

voca.means_ko:
[어사이d]
한쪽으로, (길을) 비켜, 
(나중에 쓰려고) 따로, 별도로 하고, 
곁에, 조금 떨어져
방백, 소리낮춰 하는 말, 여담
voca.means_en:
If you move something aside, you move it to one side of you.
If you take or draw someone aside, you take them a little way away from a group of people in order to talk to them in private.
If you move aside, you get out of someone's way.
If you set something such as time, money, or space aside for a particular purpose, you save it and do not use it for anything else.
If you brush or sweep aside a feeling or suggestion, you reject it.
An aside is a comment that a character in a play makes to the audience, which the other characters are supposed not to be able to hear.
A long, heavy tapestry had been pulled aside to reveal a small door in the stone wall.
The curtain covering the window moved aside.

ask / enquire / demand / query
If you ask someone something, you say something to them in the form of a question because you want to know the answer.
If you ask someone to do something, you tell them that you want them to do it.
If you ask to do something, you tell someone that you want to do it.
If you ask for something, you say that you would like it.
If you ask for someone, you say that you would like to speak to them.
If you ask someone's permission, opinion, or forgiveness, you try to obtain it by putting a request to them.
If you ask someone to an event or place, you invite them to go there.
If someone is asking a particular price for something, they are selling it for that price.
You reply 'don't ask me' when you do not know the answer to a question, usually when you are annoyed or surprised that you have been asked.

An aspect of something is one of the parts of its character or nature.
The aspect of a building or window is the direction in which it faces.
In grammar, aspect is the way that a verb group shows whether an activity is continuing, is repeated, or is completed. For example, in 'They were laughing', the verb is in the progressive aspect and shows that the action was continuing. Compare tense.
Someone's aspirations are their desire to achieve things.\n

voca.means_ko:
[어썰-t]
폭행, (점거를 위한)공격, 비난, 습격, 
맹렬히 공격하다, 폭행을 가하다
(청각, 후각 등을) 괴롭히다
voca.means_en:
An assault by an army is a strong attack made on an area held by the enemy.
An assault on a person is a physical attack on them.
An assault on someone's beliefs is a strong criticism of them.
Assault weapons such as rifles are intended for soldiers to use in battle rather than for purposes such as hunting.

Assistant is used in front of titles or jobs to indicate a slightly lower rank. For example, an assistant director is one rank lower than a director in an organization.
Someone's assistant is a person who helps them in their work.
An assistant is a person who works in a shop selling things to customers.

voca.means_ko:
[어수움]
(사실일 것으로) 추정/상정하다,
생각하다, 가정하다, 추측하다
(권력, 책임을) 맡다
(특질, 양상을) 따다/취하다
voca.means_en:
If you assume that something is true, you imagine that it is true, sometimes wrongly.
If something assumes a particular quality, it begins to have that quality.
You can use let us assume or let's assume when you are considering a possible situation or event, so that you can think about the consequences.

If you make an assumption that something is true or will happen, you accept that it is true or will happen, often without any real proof.\nSomeone's assumption of power or responsibility is their taking of it.\n

A planet's atmosphere is the layer of air or other gases around it.
The atmosphere of a place is the air that you breathe there.
The atmosphere of a place is the general impression that you get of it.
If a place or an event has atmosphere, it is interesting.

To attack a person or place means to try to hurt or damage them using physical violence.
If you attack a person, belief, idea, or act, you criticize them strongly.
If something such as a disease, a chemical, or an insect attacks something, it harms or spoils it.
If you attack a job or a problem, you start to deal with it in an energetic way.
In games such as football, when one team attacks the opponent's goal, they try to score a goal.
An attack of an illness is a short period in which you suffer badly from it.

voca.means_ko: [어템pt]\n~을 시도하다, 애써 해보다\n(특히 힘든일에 대한)시도, 기도, 노력, 미수, 살해기도
voca.means_en:
If you attempt to do something, especially something difficult, you try to do it.
If you make an attempt to do something, you try to do it, often without success.
An attempt on someone's life is an attempt to kill them.

Someone's attendance at an event or an institution is the fact that they are present at the event or go regularly to the institution.
The attendance at an event is the number of people who are present at it.
If someone is in attendance at a place or an event, they are there.
John: Yes. We have two classes with very low registration and attendance.

voca.means_ko:
[어텐션]
주의, 집중, 주목
관심, 흥미
(관심을 끌기 위한) 행동/배려
(구령으로) 차려
voca.means_en:
If you give someone or something your attention, you look at it, listen to it, or think about it carefully.
Attention is great interest that is shown in someone or something, particularly by the general public.
If someone or something is getting attention, they are being dealt with or cared for.
You can refer to someone's efforts to help you, or the interest they show in you, as their
If you bring something to someone's attention or draw their attention to it, you tell them about it or make them notice it.
If someone or something attracts your attention or catches your attention, you suddenly notice them.
If you pay attention to someone, you watch them, listen to them, or take notice of them. If you pay no attention to someone, you behave as if you are not aware of them or as if they are not important.
Someone's aunt is the sister of their mother or father, or the wife of their uncle.\n

An auxiliary is a person who is employed to assist other people in their work. Auxiliaries are often medical workers or members of the armed forces.
In grammar, an auxiliary or auxiliary verb is a verb which is used with a main verb, for example to form different tenses or to make the verb passive. In English, the basic auxiliary verbs are 'be', 'have', and 'do'. Modal verbs such as 'can' and 'will' are also sometimes called auxiliaries.
Auxiliary staff and troops assist other staff and troops.
I'm an average-looking person. However, I do have crooked teeth.\n
I'm awfully sorry about that problem the other day.\n
Awhile means for a short time. It is more commonly spelled 'a while', which is considered more correct, especially in British English.\n

voca.means_ko:
[엑s]
도끼
해고, (기관의) 폐쇄, (사업의) 중단
(인원, 지원금 등을) 대폭 삭감/축소하다
voca.means_en:
An axe is a tool used for cutting wood. It consists of a heavy metal blade which is sharp at one edge and attached by its other edge to the end of a long handle.
If a person or institution is facing the axe, that person is likely to lose their job or that institution is likely to be closed, usually in order to save money.
If someone's job or something such as a public service or a television programme is axed, it is ended suddenly and without discussion.

voca.means_ko: [베엑k]\n등/허리, 등뼈, 척추, 뒷면, 뒤쪽, 뒷 부분\n후원하다, 후퇴하다, 도와주다
voca.means_en:
If you move back, you move in the opposite direction to the one in which you are facing or in which you were moving before.
If you go back somewhere, you return to where you were before.
If someone or something is back in a particular state, they were in that state before and are now in it again.
A person's or animal's back is the part of their body between their head and their legs that is on the opposite side to their chest and stomach.
The back of something is the side or part of it that is towards the rear or farthest from the front. The back of something is normally not used or seen as much as the front.

to withdraw (from an agreement, etc)
Now that he had started making up a story, he couldn't back out.
"The best thing to do is to go right back out," said Boka.
When I was in junior high, we didn't have Facebook back then.\nWhat types of music did you enjoy back then?\n
Then I watched all three LOTRs back to back.\nSharon: What if you had another class back-to-back? You'd always be late for that class.\n

baggage / luggage
Your baggage consists of the bags that you take with you when you travel.
You can use baggage to refer to someone's emotional problems, fixed ideas, or prejudices.
save / rescue / bail out / redeem\nto pay somebody's bail (= the money that somebody accused of a crime has to pay if they do not appear at\n

공, 공 모양의 물체, 덩이, 뭉치

동그랗게 만들다, 동그랗게 되다
voca.means_en:
A ball is a round object that is used in games such as tennis, baseball, football, basketball, and cricket.
A ball is something or an amount of something that has a round shape.
The ball of your foot or the ball of your thumb is the rounded part where your toes join your foot or where your thumb joins your hand.
A ball is a large formal social event at which people dance.
When you ball something or when it balls, it becomes round.
If you say that the ball is in someone's court, you mean that it is his or her responsibility to take the next action or decision in a situation.
A bandage is a long strip of cloth which is wrapped around a wounded part of someone's body to protect or support it.\nIf you bandage a wound or part of someone's body, you tie a bandage around it.\n

voca.means_ko:
[바아r]
빗장, 막대, 술집
막대기, (악보의) 마디
~에 빗장걸다, 잠그다, (길을) 막다, 차단하다
~에게 (~하는 것을) 금지하다
~을 제외하고
voca.means_en:
A bar is a place where you can buy and drink alcoholic drinks.
A bar is a room in a pub or hotel where alcoholic drinks are served.
A bar is a counter on which alcoholic drinks are served.
A bar is a long, straight, stiff piece of metal.
If you bar a door, you place something in front of it or a piece of wood or metal across it in order to prevent it from being opened.
If you bar someone's way, you prevent them from going somewhere or entering a place, by blocking their path.
If someone is barred from a place or from doing something, they are officially forbidden to go there or to do it.
a clasp or pin for holding women's hair in place\n

voca.means_ko:
[베이s]
(사상, 사실 등의) 기초, 기반, 토대, 
근거지, 본부, 본사, 
~의 기초를 쌓다, ~에 근거를 두다
기본의, 기초의
voca.means_en:
basis / foundation / base
The base of something is its lowest edge or part.
The base of something is the lowest part of it, where it is attached to something else.
The base of an object such as a box or vase is the lower surface of it that touches the surface it rests on.
The base of an object that has several sections and that rests on a surface is the lower section of it.
A base is a layer of something which will have another layer added to it.
A position or thing that is a base for something is one from which that thing can be developed or achieved.
A company's client base or customer base is the group of regular clients or customers that the company gets most of its income from.

voca.means_ko:
[베이쥑]
(다른 것의 발전, 전개에) 기본/근본 적인, 
기초, 근본, 기본원리
기본적인, 기초적인, 근본적인
(모든 사람들에게) 기본적인, 필수적인
voca.means_en:
You use basic to describe things, activities, and principles that are very important or necessary, and on which others depend.
Basic goods and services are very simple ones which every human being needs. You can also refer to people's basic needs for such goods and services.
If one thing is basic to another, it is absolutely necessary to it, and the second thing cannot exist, succeed, or be imagined without it.
You can use basic to emphasize that you are referring to what you consider to be the most important aspect of a situation, and that you are not concerned with less important details.
You can use basic to describe something that is very simple in style and has only the most necessary features, without any luxuries.
Basic is used to describe a price or someone's income when this does not include any additional amounts.

A basket is a stiff container that is used for carrying or storing objects. Baskets are made from thin strips of materials such as straw, plastic, or wire woven together.
In economics, a basket of currencies or goods is the average or total value of a number of different currencies or goods.
In basketball, the basket is a net hanging from a ring through which players try to throw the ball in order to score points.
Teddy's lantern shone on a brick oven, a stone hearth, baskets of apples, and strings of onions hanging from the rafters.

A bat is a specially shaped piece of wood that is used for hitting the ball in baseball, softball, cricket, rounders, or table tennis.
A bat is a small flying animal that looks like a mouse with wings made of skin. Bats are active at night.
When you bat, you have a turn at hitting the ball with a bat in baseball, softball, cricket, or rounders.
When something surprising or shocking happens, if someone doesn't bat an eyelid in British English, or doesn't bat an eye in American English, they remain calm and do not show any reaction.
Annie batted the animal's paws.
When the lights went out, she was as blind as a bat.

Batteries are small devices that provide the power for electrical items such as radios and children's toys.
A car battery is a rectangular box containing acid that is found in a car engine. It provides the electricity needed to start the car.
A battery of equipment such as guns, lights, or computers is a large set of it kept together in one place.
A battery of people or things is a very large number of them.
A battery of tests is a set of tests that is used to assess a number of different aspects of something, such as your health.
Battery farming is a system of breeding chickens and hens in which large numbers of them are kept in small cages, and used for their meat and eggs.

campaign / battle / struggle / drive / war / fight
A battle is a violent fight between groups of people, especially one between military forces during a war.
A battle is a conflict in which different people or groups compete in order to achieve success or control.
You can use battle to refer to someone's efforts to achieve something in spite of very difficult circumstances.
To battle with an opposing group means to take part in a fight or contest against them. In American English, you can also say that one group or person is battling another.
To battle means to try hard to do something in spite of very difficult circumstances. In British English, you battle against something or with something. In American English, you battle something.

Lodging facilities are booked to capacity.
The flight was booked to capacity.
Thankfully, the hotel wasn't booked to capacity.
These days, good teeth are considered important. They are a big part of someone's first impression.\n

We were obviously disappointed about that.
Are you still disappointed about your TOEIC score?
Don't be too disappointed about that.

You can walk, because it is just a stone's throw away.

She was kept awake all night by the baby.

However, I am willing to endure it. It's the price to pay to feel confident when I smile.\n

A bird's beak is the hard curved or pointed part of its mouth.
Moonlight shone on its sleek blue-black wings, its shaggy throat feathers, its thick neck and big beak.
His raven heart thumping, he walked to the diamond and nudged it with his beak.

If you bear something somewhere, you carry it there or take it there.
If you bear something such as a weapon, you hold it or carry it with you.
If one thing bears the weight of something else, it supports the weight of that thing.
If something bears a particular mark or characteristic, it has that mark or characteristic.
If you bear an unpleasant experience, you accept it because you are unable to do anything about it.
If you can't bear someone or something, you dislike them very much.
If someone bears the cost of something, they pay for it.
A man's beard is the hair that grows on his chin and cheeks.\nTheir hair and beards were long and scraggly.\n

voca.means_en:
If something has a bearing on a situation or event, it is relevant to it.
If you get your bearings or find your bearings, you find out where you are or what you should do next. If you lose your bearings, you do not know where you are or what you should do next.
Someone's bearing is the way in which they move or stand.
If you take a bearing with a compass, you use it to work out the direction in which a particular place lies or in which something is moving.
Bearings are small metal balls that are placed between moving parts of a machine in order to make them move smoothly and easily over each other.

voca.means_en: It's hard to know what you want to say when you beat around the bush.\nMindy: Come on just tell me. Don't beat around the bush.\n

If you beg someone to do something, you ask them very anxiously or eagerly to do it.
If someone who is poor is begging, they are asking people to give them food or money.
You say 'I beg to differ' when you are politely emphasizing that you disagree with someone.
If you say that something is going begging, you mean that it is available but no one is using it or accepting it.

If you do something on someone's behalf, you do it for that person as their representative. The form in someone's behalf is also used, mainly in American English.\nIf you feel, for example, embarrassed or angry on someone's behalf, you feel embarrassed or angry for them.\n

People's or animals' behaviour is the way that they behave. You can refer to a typical and repeated way of behaving as a behaviour.\nIn science, the behaviour of something is the way that it behaves.\n

Bellyache is a pain inside your abdomen, especially in your stomach.
If you say that someone is bellyaching, you mean they complain loudly and frequently about something and you think this is unreasonable or unjustified.
Harry: But you'll probably bellyache about it being too hot.
Please make sure all belongings are with you\n

voca.means_en:
Something that is beneath another thing is under the other thing.
If you talk about what is beneath the surface of something, you are talking about the aspects of it which are hidden or not obvious.
If you say that someone or something is beneath you, you feel that they are not good enough for you or not suitable for you.
It says The gold doth lie beneath the whale's eye.
During the late Ice Age in Europe, they sometimes lived in caves beneath cliffs.
Not only was his body missing, but the fog beneath the bridge was moving in a wild, spinning whirl.

voca.means_en:
Best is the superlative of good.
Best is the superlative of well.
The best is used to refer to things of the highest quality or standard.
Someone's best is the greatest effort or highest achievement or standard that they are capable of.
If you say that something is the best that can be done or hoped for, you think it is the most pleasant, successful, or useful thing that can be done or hoped for.
If you like something best or like it the best, you prefer it.
You use best of all to indicate that what you are about to mention is the thing that you prefer or that has most advantages out of all the things you have mentioned.

voca.means_ko: 가장 안전한 선택\n가장 안전하고 확실한 방책/수단
voca.means_en: When in doubt, bottled water is the best bet.\n

If you bet on the result of a horse race, football game, or other event, you give someone a sum of money which they give you back with extra money if the result is what you predicted, or which they keep if it is not.
If someone is betting that something will happen, they are hoping or expecting that it will happen.
A bet is a sum of money which you give to someone when you bet.
You use expressions such as 'I bet', 'I'll bet', and 'you can bet' to indicate that you are sure something is true.

voca.means_en:
cheat / fool / deceive / betray / take in / trick / con
If you betray someone who loves or trusts you, your actions hurt and disappoint them.
If someone betrays their country or their friends, they give information to an enemy, putting their country's security or their friends' safety at risk.
If you betray an ideal or your principles, you say or do something which goes against those beliefs.
If you betray a feeling or quality, you show it without intending to.

voca.means_en:
If you like one thing better than another, you like it more.
If you are better after an illness or injury, you have recovered from it. If you feel better, you no longer feel so ill.
You use had better or 'd better when you are advising, warning, or threatening someone, or expressing an opinion about what should happen.
You can say that someone is better doing one thing than another, or it is better doing one thing than another, to advise someone about what they should do.
If something changes for the better, it improves.
A biography of someone is an account of their life, written by someone else.\nBiography is the branch of literature which deals with accounts of people's lives.\n

When a baby is born, you refer to this event as his or her birth.
You can refer to the beginning or origin of something as its birth.
Some people talk about a person's birth when they are referring to the social position of the person's family.

A bit of something is a small amount of it.
A bit of something is a small part or section of it.
A bit of something is a small piece of it.
You can use bit to refer to a particular item or to one of a group or set of things. For example, a bit of information is an item of information.
In computing, a bit is the smallest unit of information that is held in a computer's memory. It is either 1 or 0. Several bits form a byte.

If you blame a person or thing for something bad, you believe or say that they are responsible for it or that they caused it.
If you say that you do not blame someone for doing something, you mean that you consider it was a reasonable thing to do in the circumstances.
The blame for something bad that has happened is the responsibility for causing it or letting it happen.
If someone is to blame for something bad that has happened, they are responsible for causing it.
He blamed magic for all of Camelot's woes.

voca.means_en:
Something that is blank has nothing on it.
If you look blank, your face shows no feeling, understanding, or interest.
A blank is a space which is left in a piece of writing or on a printed form for you to fill in particular information.
If your mind or memory is a blank, you cannot think of anything or remember anything.
Blanks are gun cartridges which contain explosive but do not contain a bullet, so that they cause no harm when the gun is fired.
If you draw a blank when you are looking for someone or something, you do not succeed in finding them.
If your mind goes blank, you are suddenly unable to think of anything appropriate to say, for example in reply to a question.
Arthur looked at his friend blankly.\n

bleed - bled - bled
When you bleed, you lose blood from your body as a result of injury or illness.
If the colour of one substance bleeds into the colour of another substance that it is touching, it goes into the other thing so that its colour changes in an undesirable way.
If someone is being bled, money or other resources are gradually being taken away from them.
Well, can't you see I'm bleeding now? I think taking me to the hospital is a good idea!

When someone such as a priest blesses people or things, he asks for God's favour and protection for them.\nBless is used in expressions such as 'God bless' or 'bless you' to express affection, thanks, or good wishes.\nYou can say 'bless you' to someone who has just sneezed.

voca.means_en:
blind / blindly
Someone who is blind is unable to see because their eyes are damaged.
If you are blind with something such as tears or a bright light, you are unable to see for a short time because of the tears or light.
If you say that someone is blind to a fact or a situation, you mean that they ignore it or are unaware of it, although you think that they should take notice of it or be aware of it.
You can describe someone's beliefs or actions as blind when you think that they seem to take no notice of important facts or behave in an unreasonable way.
A blind corner is one that you cannot see round because something is blocking your view.
If something blinds you, it makes you unable to see, either for a short time or permanently.

A blindfold is a strip of cloth that is tied over someone's eyes so that they cannot see.
If you blindfold someone, you tie a blindfold over their eyes.
If someone does something blindfold, they do it while wearing a blindfold.
If you say that you can do something blindfold, you are emphasizing that you can do it easily, for example because you have done it many times before.
I could get there blindfolded with one hand tied behind my back.

voca.means_ko:

voca.means_en:
building / property / premises / complex / structure / block / edifice
A block of flats or offices is a large building containing them.
A block in a town is an area of land with streets on all its sides.
A block of a substance is a large rectangular piece of it.
A block of something such as tickets or shares is a large quantity of them, especially when they are all sold at the same time and are in a particular sequence or order.
If you have a mental block or a block, you are temporarily unable to do something that you can normally do which involves using, thinking about, or remembering something.
To block a road, channel, or pipe means to put an object across it or in it so that nothing can pass through it or along it.
If something blocks your view, it prevents you from seeing something because it is between you and that thing.
If you block someone's way, you prevent them from going somewhere or entering a place by standing in front of them.

Blood is the red liquid that flows inside your body, which you can see if you cut yourself.
You can use blood to refer to the race or social class of someone's parents or ancestors.
If you say that there is bad blood between people, you mean that they have argued about something and dislike each other.
If you say that something makes your blood boil, you are emphasizing that it makes you very angry.
If something violent and cruel is done in cold blood, it is done deliberately and in an unemotional way.
If you say that something makes your blood run cold or makes your blood freeze, you mean that it makes you feel very frightened.
"I told you our blood would boil if we went out there" he said.

A bloom is the flower on a plant.
If something such as someone's skin has a bloom, it has a fresh and healthy appearance.
A plant or tree that is in bloom has flowers on it.
When a plant or tree blooms, it produces flowers. When a flower blooms, it opens.
If someone or something blooms, they develop good, attractive, or successful qualities.

If something is a blot on a person's or thing's reputation, it spoils their reputation.
A blot is a drop of liquid that has fallen on to a surface and has dried.
If you blot a surface, you remove liquid from it by pressing a piece of soft paper or cloth onto it.
If you describe something such as a building as a blot on the landscape, you mean that you think it is very ugly and spoils an otherwise attractive place.
to permit (a gas under pressure, esp steam) to be released\n"I'll hold on to the hood so it won't blow off," she said.\n
A blurry shape is one that has an unclear outline.\nWell, my vision has gotten blurry and I can't see well at night.\n
If a woman's hair is bobbed, it is cut in a bob.\n
Your bodily needs and functions are the needs and functions of your body.\nYou use bodily to indicate that an action involves the whole of someone's body.\n

Your body is all your physical parts, including your head, arms, and legs.
You can also refer to the main part of your body, except for your arms, head, and legs, as your body.
You can refer to a person's dead body as a body.
A body is an organized group of people who deal with something officially.
A body of people is a group of people who are together or who are connected in some way.
The body of something such as a building or a document is the main part of it or the largest part of it.

voca.means_en:
A bolt is a long metal object which screws into a nut and is used to fasten things together.
A bolt on a door or window is a metal bar that you can slide across in order to fasten the door or window.
A bolt of lightning is a flash of lightning that is seen as a white line in the sky.
When you bolt one thing to another, you fasten them firmly together, using a bolt.
When you bolt a door or window, you slide the bolt across to fasten it.
If a person or animal bolts, they suddenly start to run very fast, often because something has frightened them.
If you bolt your food, you eat it so quickly that you hardly chew it or taste it.
The four of them bolted back from the edge of the rocky slope.
Suddenly, Jack felt like he'd been hit by a bolt of lightning.
They bolted across the room.

voca.means_en: A woman's boobs are her breasts.\nIf you boob, you make a mistake.\n

voca.means_en:
A book is a number of pieces of paper, usually with words printed on them, which are fastened together and fixed inside a cover of stronger paper or cardboard. Books contain information, stories, or poetry, for example.
A book of something such as stamps, matches, or tickets is a small number of them fastened together between thin cardboard covers.
A company's or organization's books are its records of money that has been spent and earned or of the names of people who belong to it.
When you book something such as a hotel room or a ticket, you arrange to have it or use it at a particular time.
When a referee books a football player who has seriously broken the rules of the game, he or she officially writes down the player's name.
When a police officer books someone, he or she officially records their name and the offence that they may be charged with.

voca.means_en:
If there is a boom in the economy, there is an increase in economic activity, for example in the amount of things that are being bought and sold.
A boom in something is an increase in its amount, frequency, or success.
On a boat, the boom is the long pole which is attached to the bottom of the sail and to the mast and which you move when you want to alter the direction in which you are sailing.
If the economy or a business is booming, the amount of things being bought or sold is increasing.
When something such as someone's voice, a cannon, or a big drum booms, it makes a loud, deep sound that lasts for several seconds.
A booming snore shattered the air.
"Camelot is dying!" the Christmas Knight boomed.
if somebody's eyes bore into somebody/something, they stare in a way that makes somebody feel uncomfortable\n

When a baby is born, it comes out of its mother's body at the beginning of its life. In formal English, if you say that someone is born of someone or to someone, you mean that person is their parent.
If someone is born with a particular disease, problem, or characteristic, they have it from the time they are born.
You can use be born in front of a particular name to show that a person was given this name at birth, although they may be better known by another name.
You use born to describe someone who has a natural ability to do a particular activity or job. For example, if you are a born cook, you have a natural ability to cook well.

borrow / lend
If you borrow something that belongs to someone else, you take it or use it for a period of time, usually with their permission.
If you borrow money from someone or from a bank, they give it to you and you agree to pay it back at some time in the future.
If you borrow a book from a library, you take it away for a fixed period of time.
If you borrow something such as a word or an idea from another language or from another person's work, you use it in your own language or work.
Someone who is living on borrowed time or who is on borrowed time has continued to live or to do something for longer than was expected, and is likely to die or be stopped from doing it soon.

If you do not bother to do something or if you do not bother with it, you do not do it, consider it, or use it because you think it is unnecessary or because you are too lazy.
If something bothers you, or if you bother about it, it worries, annoys, or upsets you.
If someone bothers you, they talk to you when you want to be left alone or interrupt you when you are busy.
Bother means trouble or difficulty. You can also use bother to refer to an activity which causes this, especially when you would prefer not to do it or get involved with it.
If you say that you can't be bothered to do something, you mean that you are not going to do it because you think it is unnecessary or because you are too lazy.
"I don't think so..." something bothered Jack.
A : In that case, I'm sorry to bother you. Take as much time as you need.

묶인, 구속된, ~할 의무가 있는,
voca.means_en:
certain / bound / sure / definite / as sured
Bounds are limits which normally restrict what can happen or what people can do.
A bound is a long or high jump.
If an area of land is bounded by something, that thing is situated around its edge.
If someone's life or situation is bounded by certain things, those are its most important aspects and it is limited or restricted by them.
If a person or animal bounds in a particular direction, they move quickly with large steps or jumps.
If you say that a feeling or quality knows no bounds, you are emphasizing that it is very strong or intense.
If a place is out of bounds, people are not allowed to go there.

voca.means_ko: [보이]\n소년, 남자/사내 아이\n어머나, 맙소사(놀람. 기쁨, 아픔 등을 나타내는 소리)
voca.means_en:
A boy is a child who will grow up to be a man.
You can refer to a young man as a boy, especially when talking about relationships between boys and girls.
Someone's boy is their son.
You can refer to a man as a boy, especially when you are talking about him in an affectionate way.
Some people say 'boy' or 'oh boy' in order to express feelings of excitement or admiration.

voca.means_ko:

떠받치다, 보강하다, 중괄호로 묶다
(스스로) 대비하다, 대비시키다
(넘어지지 않게) 버팅기다, (몽에) 단단히 힘을 주다

voca.means_en:
If you brace yourself for something unpleasant or difficult, you prepare yourself for it.
If you brace yourself against something or brace part of your body against it, you press against something in order to steady your body or to avoid falling.
To brace something means to strengthen or support it with something else.
If you brace your shoulders or knees, you keep them stiffly in a particular position.
You can refer to two things of the same kind as a brace of that thing. The plural form is also brace.
A brace is a device attached to a part of a person's body, for example to a weak leg, in order to strengthen or support it.
Braces are a pair of straps that pass over your shoulders and fasten to your trousers at the front and back in order to stop them from falling down.

voca.means_en:
Braid is a narrow piece of decorated cloth or twisted threads, which is used to decorate clothes or curtains.
A braid is a length of hair which has been divided into three or more lengths and then braided.
If you braid hair or a group of threads, you twist three or more lengths of the hair or threads over and under each other to make one thick length.
They made ropes by braiding plant fibers.
Morgan tugged on one of Annie's braids.
His black hair was braided and had a feather in it.
Annie's braids floated on the wind.

Your brain is the organ inside your head that controls your body's activities and enables you to think and to feel things such as heat and pain.
Your brain is your mind and the way that you think.
If someone has brains or a good brain, they have the ability to learn and understand things quickly, to solve problems, and to make good decisions.
If someone is the brains behind an idea or an organization, he or she had that idea or makes the important decisions about how that organization is managed.

voca.means_ko: 고장나다, 실패하다, 아주 나빠지다\n감정을 주체하지 못하다/허불어지다\n무너지다, 절연 파괴되다
voca.means_en:
if a vehicle, etc. breaks down, it stops working because of a fault
if talks, a marriage, etc. break down, they fail
to lose control of your feelings and start crying
if your health breaks down, it becomes very bad
(into something) to be divided into parts so that it is easier to discuss, to analyse or to deal with
(into something) if a substance breaks down, it separates into different parts or changes into something else in a chemical process
The elevator broke down again at work. We all had to use the stairs.
The washer started to break down.
The product hasn't broken down for a long time.
Turn it off before it breaks down.

to enter a building, open a car, etc. illegally and by force
to suddenly begin to do something such as laugh, shout, run, etc.
to use a note/bill of high value to buy something costing less
to interrupt somebody's thoughts
to start to get involved in an activity and be successful at it, especially when this is difficult
to open and use something that you have been saving for an emergency or a special occasion
He blew out a puff of air, then broke into a leaping run.
They broke into the circle on either side of the knights.
He broke into a big grin.

A woman's breasts are the two soft, round parts on her chest that can produce milk to feed a baby.
A person's breast is the upper part of his or her chest.
A bird's breast is the front part of its body.
The breast of a shirt, jacket, or coat is the part which covers the top part of the chest.
You can refer to piece of meat that is cut from the front of a bird or lamb as breast.

A bridle is a set of straps that is put around a horse's head and mouth so that the person riding or driving the horse can control it.
If you bridle, you show that you are angry or offended by moving your head and body upwards in a proud way.
Saddles and bridles hung from pegs on the walls.

voca.means_en:
Something that is brief lasts for only a short time.
A brief speech or piece of writing does not contain too many words or details.
If you are brief, you say what you want to say in as few words as possible.
You can describe a period of time as brief if you want to emphasize that it is very short.
Men's or women's underpants can be referred to as briefs.
If someone briefs you, especially about a piece of work or a serious matter, they give you information that you need before you do it or consider it.

to make something happen
I'm shocked! What brought this about?
Protest can bring about change in the law.

to move something from a lower to a higher position
to mention a subject and start to talk about it
(to something) to increase a total, a price, a number, etc. to a higher level or amount
to bring food from the stomach back out through the mouth
Paul always brings up political questions.
Sharon: Doesn't anyone bring it up with the teacher?
A man's brotherly feelings are feelings of love and loyalty which you expect a brother to show.\n

If you call someone, usually a man, a brute, you mean that they are rough, violent, and insensitive.
When you refer to brute strength or force, you are contrasting it with gentler methods or qualities.
Or we'll be meat for those evil brutes!

voca.means_en:
A buck is a US or Australian dollar.
A buck is the male of various animals, including the deer, antelope, rabbit and kangaroo.
If a horse bucks, it kicks both of its back legs wildly into the air, or jumps into the air wildly with all four feet off the ground.
If you buck the trend, you obtain different results from others in the same area. If you buck the system, you get what you want by breaking or ignoring the rules.
If you get more bang for the buck, you spend your money wisely and get more for your money than if you were to spend it in a different way.
It bucked like a bronco.
Oh come on. You're making big bucks.
He's paying his lawyer big bucks.
B : They only gave it a once-over and charged me 500 bucks.

voca.means_ko: [닫]\n싹, 눈, 봉오리, 미성년\n싹(눈)트다, 봉오리지다, 싹트게 하다
voca.means_en:
A bud is a small pointed lump that appears on a tree or plant and develops into a leaf or flower.
When a tree or plant is budding, buds are appearing on it or are beginning to open.
When a tree or plant is in bud or has come into bud, it has buds on it.
If you nip something such as bad behaviour in the bud, you stop it before it can develop very far.
Put the seed in the ground when the oak-tree bud is as small as a mouse's ear.

voca.means_ko:
[빌d]
(건물을) 짓다, 건축/건설하다, 만들다, 세우다
커지다, 쌓이다
(사람의) 체구
voca.means_en:
build / construct / assemble / erect / set up / put up / put together
If you build something, you make it by joining things together.
If you build something into a wall or object, you make it in such a way that it is in the wall or object, or is part of it.
If people build an organization, a society, or a relationship, they gradually form it.
If you build an organization, system, or product on something, you base it on it.
If you build something into a policy, system, or product, you make it part of it.
To build someone's confidence or trust means to increase it gradually. If someone's confidence or trust builds, it increases gradually.
If you build on the success of something, you take advantage of this success in order to make further progress.
If pressure, speed, sound, or excitement builds, it gradually becomes greater.

voca.means_ko:

voca.means_en:
You can refer to something's bulk when you want to emphasize that it is very large.
You can refer to a large person's body or to their weight or size as their bulk.
The bulk of something is most of it.
If you buy or sell something in bulk, you buy or sell it in large quantities.

voca.means_ko: [^비z니s]\n사업, 상업, 장사\n(직장의) 일, 업무, (관여되는) 일, 소관
voca.means_en:
Business is work relating to the production, buying, and selling of goods or services.
Business is used when talking about how many products or services a company is able to sell. If business is good, a lot of products or services are being sold and if business is bad, few of them are being sold.
A business is an organization which produces and sells goods or which provides a service.
Business is work or some other activity that you do as part of your job and not for pleasure.
You can use business to refer to a particular area of work or activity in which the aim is to make a profit.
You can use business to refer to something that you are doing or concerning yourself with.
You can use business to refer to important matters that you have to deal with.

(특히 여성의 의류나 신체 치수를 말한때) 가슴(둘레)
voca.means_en:
If you bust something, you break it or damage it so badly that it cannot be used.
If someone is busted, the police arrest them.
If police bust a place, they go to it in order to arrest people who are doing something illegal.
A company or fund that is bust has no money left and has been forced to close down.
If a company goes bust, it loses so much money that it is forced to close down.
A bust is a statue of the head and shoulders of a person.
You can use bust to refer to a woman's breasts, especially when you are describing their size.

voca.means_en:
You use but to introduce something which contrasts with what you have just said, or to introduce something which adds to what you have just said.
You use but when you are about to add something further in a discussion or to change the subject.
You use but after you have made an excuse or apologized for what you are just about to say.
You use but to introduce a reply to someone when you want to indicate surprise, disbelief, refusal, or protest.
But is used to mean 'except'.
But is used to mean 'only'.
You use buts in expressions like 'no buts' and 'ifs and buts' to refer to reasons someone gives for not doing something, especially when you do not think that they are good reasons.
