걷다, 달리다, 도망가다
(여정, 경주의) 구간
voca.means_en:
A person or animal's legs are the long parts of their body that they use to stand on.
The legs of a pair of trousers are the parts that cover your legs.
The legs of a table, chair, or other piece of furniture are the parts that rest on the floor and support the furniture's weight.
A leg of a long journey is one part of it, usually between two points where you stop.
A leg of a sports competition is one of a series of games that are played to find an overall winner.

voca.means_ko: 더 작은/덜한, 더 작게\n더 적게, 덜하게\n~을 빼고/계산에 넣지 않고
voca.means_en:
You use less to indicate that there is a smaller amount of something than before or than average. You can use 'a little', 'a lot', 'a bit', 'far', and 'much' in front of less.
You use less to indicate that something or someone has a smaller amount of a quality than they used to or than is average or usual.
If you say that something is less one thing than another, you mean that it is like the second thing rather than the first.

Traveling has been become less of a bother.
It's less of a bother if you have a car.
Doing the dishes is less of a bother with a dishwasher.

voca.means_ko:
[렛t]
(~하게) 놓아두다, ~하게 해주다, 시키다, 
(~을 하도록) 허락하다, 허용하다, 
~하자/합시다, 해보자
~해 드릴게요.
~ 하겠다
voca.means_en:
rent / hire / let
If you let something happen, you allow it to happen without doing anything to stop or prevent it.
If you let someone do something, you give them your permission to do it.
If you let someone into, out of, or through a place, you allow them to enter, leave, or go through it, for example by opening a door or making room for them.
You use let me when you are introducing something you want to say.
You say let's or, in more formal English, let us, to direct the attention of the people you are talking to towards the subject that you want to consider next.
You say let's or, in formal English, let us, when you are making a suggestion that involves both you and the person you are talking to, or when you are agreeing to a suggestion of this kind.
Someone in authority, such as a teacher, can use let's or, in more formal English, let us, in order to give a polite instruction to another person or group of people.
People often use let in expressions such as let me see or let me think when they are hesitating or thinking of what to say next.
You can use let when you are saying what you think someone should do, usually when they are behaving in a way that you think is unreasonable or wrong.
release energy, strong feelings, nervous tension, etc. by intense physical activity or noisy behaviour\nA : I think you need to let off some steam.\n

allow somebody to be free
stop holding somebody/something
Jack let go of Annie's hand.
He let go of the hand of the dancer on his right and threw himself out fo the dance-pulling the knight on his left with him.

to allow somebody not to do something or not to go somewhere
to allow somebody to get out of a vehicle, especially a bus
I'll let you off this time. Hurry up!

voca.means_ko: 빚, 부채, 채무, 법적 책임, 의무
voca.means_en: If you say that someone or something is a liability, you mean that they cause a lot of problems or embarrassment.\nA company's or organization's liabilities are the sums of money which it owes.\n

A lieutenant is a person who holds a junior officer's rank in the army, navy, marines, or air force, or in the American police force.\nIf you refer to someone as a person's lieutenant, you mean they are that person's assistant, especially their main assistant, in an organization or activity.\n

voca.means_ko: [라이f]\n살아 있음, 삶, 인생, 생활\n(개인의) 평생, (생의 일부분인) 시절/시기
voca.means_en:
Life is the quality which people, animals, and plants have when they are not dead, and which objects and substances do not have.
You can use life to refer to things or groups of things which are alive.
If you refer to someone's life, you mean their state of being alive, especially when there is a risk or danger of them dying.
Someone's life is the period of time during which they are alive.
You can use life to refer to a period of someone's life when they are in a particular situation or job.
Lifelong means existing or happening for the whole of a person's life.\n

voca.means_ko: (담배를) 피워 물다\n(빛, 색으로) 환하게 되다/만들다\n환해지다, 빛이 나다
voca.means_en:
to become or to make something bright with light or colour
to start working; to make something start working
if a person's eyes or face light up, or something lights them up, they become bright with excitement or happiness

Lightning is the very bright flashes of light in the sky that happen during thunderstorms.
Lightning describes things that happen very quickly or last for only a short time.
Suddenly, Jack felt like he'd been hit by a bolt of lightning.

(표면에 그은) 선, 열, 줄, 행
(특히 경기장의 경계를 나타내는) 라인, 선, 줄, 경계(선)

(영극, 영화의) 대사, (글의) 행, (노래의) 가사

voca.means_en:
border / boundary / line / frontier
A line is a long thin mark which is drawn or painted on a surface.
The lines on someone's skin, especially on their face, are long thin marks that appear there as they grow older.
A line of people or things is a number of them arranged one behind the other or side by side.
A line of people or vehicles is a number of them that are waiting one behind another, for example in order to buy something or to go in a particular direction.
A line of a piece of writing is one of the rows of words, numbers, or other symbols in it.
A line of a poem, song, or play is a group of words that are spoken or sung together. If an actor learns his or her lines for a play or film, they learn what they have to say.
You can refer to a long piece of wire, string, or cable as a line when it is used for a particular purpose.
A line is a connection which makes it possible for two people to speak to each other on the telephone.
You can use line to refer to a telephone number which you can ring in order to get information or advice.
A line is a route, especially a dangerous or secret one, along which people move or send messages or supplies.
The line in which something or someone moves is the particular route that they take, especially when they keep moving straight ahead.
A line is a particular route, involving the same stations, roads, or stops along which a train or bus service regularly operates.
If people or things line a road, room, or other place, they are present in large numbers along its edges or sides.
If you line a wall, container, or other object, you put a layer of something such as leaves or paper on the inside surface of it in order to make it stronger, warmer, or cleaner.
hate / dislike / can't stand / despise / can't bear / loathe / detest\nIf you loathe something or someone, you dislike them very much.\n

voca.means_ko:
[^라-쥐]
오두막, 산장, 수위실
북미 원주민의 천막집
(공공 기관, 당국에 이의 등을) 제기/제출 하다
셋방을 얻다, 하숙하다
~를 재워주다, 머무르게 하다
voca.means_en:
A lodge is a house or hut in the country or in the mountains where people stay on holiday, especially when they want to shoot or fish.
A lodge is a small house at the entrance to the grounds of a large house.
In some organizations, a lodge is a local branch or meeting place of the organization.
If you lodge a complaint, protest, accusation, or claim, you officially make it.
If you lodge somewhere, such as in someone else's house or if you are lodged there, you live there, usually paying rent.
If someone lodges you somewhere, they give you a place to stay, for example because they are responsible for your safety or comfort.
If an object lodges somewhere, it becomes stuck there.

I had to lodge a complaint.
Who do I call to lodge a complaint?
I've never seen her lodging a complaint.

If you are provided with lodging or lodgings, you are provided with a place to stay for a period of time. You can use lodgings to refer to one or more of these places.\nIf you live in lodgings, you live in a room or rooms in someone's house and you pay them for this.\n

Long means a great amount of time or for a great amount of time.
You use long to ask or talk about amounts of time.
Long is used in expressions such as all year long, the whole day long, and your whole life long to say and emphasize that something happens for the whole of a particular period of time.
A long event or period of time lasts for a great amount of time or takes a great amount of time.
A long speech, book, film, or list contains a lot of information or a lot of items and takes a lot of time to listen to, read, watch, or deal with.
If you say that something is the case as long as or so long as something else is the case, you mean that it is only the case if the second thing is the case.
If you say that someone won't be long, you mean that you think they will arrive or be back soon. If you say that it won't be long before something happens, you mean that you think it will happen soon

voca.means_ko: 돌봐주다, 보살피다, ~을 지켜보다\n~을 눈으로 쫒다, 배웅하다\n~에 주의하다, 유의하다
voca.means_en:
take care of / look after / care for
to deal with something; to be responsible for something
to make sure that somebody/something is safe; take care of somebody/something
to make sure that things happen to somebody's advantage

to think about what is going to happen in the future
I try not to look ahead. It's too depressing.
Les: The last few years have not gone well so I'm looking ahead to the future.
She lost control of herself when she saw her husband kissing another woman.\nChristina: Don't be so sure. You might lose control of yourself.\n

Thanks to low-cost carriers, more people are traveling to Europe and the U.S. as well.
More people are traveling on low-cost carriers.
There are no free drinks on low-cost carriers.
We got tickets for a low-cost carrier.

voca.means_ko: [메지션]\n(오락으로 마술을 공연하는) 마술사\n(이야기 속에 나오는) 마법사
voca.means_en:
A magician is a person who entertains people by doing magic tricks.
When they did not come back, Arthur turned against his magicians.
Remember, he's a magician, not a mortal.

main / major / key / central / principal / chief / prime
You use major when you want to describe something that is more important, serious, or significant than other things in a group or situation.
In music, a major scale is one in which the third note is two tones higher than the first.
A major is an officer who is one rank above captain in the British army or the United States army, air force, or marines.
At a university or college in the United States, a student's major is the main subject that they are studying.
At a university or college in the United States, if a student is, for example, a geology major, geology is the main subject they are studying.
A major is a large or important company.
The majors are groups of professional sports teams that compete against each other, especially in American baseball.
A major is an important sporting competition, especially in golf or tennis.
If a student at a university or college in the United States majors in a particular subject, that subject is the main one they study.
When it comes to travelling, safety is a major concern.\n
Rotting fish?' said Annie, making a face.\n
B : I'll make sure to make it to the next one.\n
She needs two jobs just to make her rent.\nDavid: I needed the money. I couldn't make my rent. My hours at work were cut.\n
A : Then start the meeting without me, but make sure to take notes.\nPlease make sure all belongings are with you.\n
to end an argument or a disagreement with somebody\nAfter their argument they made up. Now they're happy again.\n

voca.means_ko: [메익오버r]\n(사람, 장소의 모습을 개선하기 위한) 단장\n(모양을) 고처 만들기, 형을 바꾸기, 수선
voca.means_en:
If a person or room is given a makeover, their appearance is improved, usually by an expert.
If an organization or system is given a makeover, important changes are made in order to improve it.
Steve: Then let's make up.

voca.means_ko:
[^메익껍]
조립, 구성, 구조, (사람의) 체격, 체질, 성질, 기질
화장품, 화장도구, 얼굴 단장, 화장하기
(인쇄물의) 편집배열, 레이아웃,
voca.means_en: "I'm going to go put on my ghoul makeup now."\n

A maniac is a mad person who is violent and dangerous.
If you call someone, for example, a religious maniac or a sports maniac, you are critical of them because they have such a strong interest in religion or sport.
If you describe someone's behaviour as maniac, you are emphasizing that it is extremely foolish and uncontrolled.

voca.means_ko:
[^매너r]
(일의) 방식, (사람의) 태도, 
(특정 사회, 문화의) 예절, 
방법, 예절, 태도, 습관, 관습
voca.means_en:
The manner in which you do something is the way that you do it.
Someone's manner is the way in which they behave and talk when they are with other people, for example whether they are polite, confident, or bad-tempered.
If someone has good manners, they are polite and observe social customs. If someone has bad manners, they are impolite and do not observe these customs.
If you refer to all manner of objects or people, you are talking about objects or people of many different kinds.
You say in a manner of speaking to indicate that what you have just said is true, but not absolutely or exactly true
They ate without manners or delight.

voca.means_ko: [메뉴sk릡t]\n(책, 악보 등의) 원고, 문서, 손으로 쓴 것\n필사본, 사본
voca.means_en: A manuscript is a handwritten or typed document, especially a writer's first version of a book before it is published.\n

voca.means_ko:
[^마r블]
대리석, 
(아이들이 가지고 노는) 구슬, 구슬치기
제정신, 지적 능력
voca.means_en:
Marble is a type of very hard rock which feels cold when you touch it and which shines when it is cut and polished. Statues and parts of buildings are sometimes made of marble.
Marbles are sculptures made of marble.
Marbles is a children's game played with small balls, usually made of coloured glass. You roll a ball along the ground and try to hit an opponent's ball with it.
A marble is one of the small balls used in the game of marbles.
It was no bigger than a marble.

voca.means_ko:
[마r-k]
자국, 표시, 특징
(표, 기호 등으로) ~에 표시하다, ~을 나타내다
흔적/자국을 남기다
유의해서 듣다
기념하다, 표시하다
voca.means_en:
mark / stain / streak / speck / blot / smear / spot
A mark is a small area of something such as dirt that has accidentally got onto a surface or piece of clothing.
A mark is a written or printed symbol, for example a letter of the alphabet.
A mark is a point that is given for a correct answer or for doing something well in an exam or competition. A mark can also be a written symbol such as a letter that indicates how good a student's or competitor's work or performance is.
If something marks a surface, or if the surface marks, the surface is damaged by marks or a mark.
If you mark something with a particular word or symbol, you write that word or symbol on it.
The day marks the formation of Korea.
Today marks our 3rd wedding anniversary.
We had a party to mark his birthday.

voca.means_ko:
[메s떠r]
주인, 선생, 거장
~을 정복하다, 숙달하다, ~을 완전히 익히다
주요한, 최상의
voca.means_en:
A servant's master is the man that he or she works for.
A dog's master is the man or boy who owns it.
If you say that someone is a master of a particular activity, you mean that they are extremely skilled at it.
If you master something, you learn how to do it properly or you succeed in understanding it completely.
If you master a difficult situation, you succeed in controlling it.
A master copy of something such as a film or a tape recording is an original copy that can be used to produce other copies

voca.means_ko: [메릳]\n(특히 물에 젖었거나 더러워서) 엉겨 붙은, 들러 붙은
voca.means_en: If you describe someone's hair as matted, you mean that it has become a thick untidy mass, often because it is wet or dirty.\n

voca.means_ko:
[미인]
의미하다, ~하려고 생각하다, 작정이다, 의도하다
수단, 방법
인색한, 못된, 뒤떨어진, 비열한, 열등한, 초라한
보통의, 평균의, (산술) 평균
voca.means_en:
mean - meant - meant
If you want to know what a word, code, signal, or gesture means, you want to know what it refers to or what its message is.
If you ask someone what they mean, you are asking them to explain exactly what or who they are referring to or what they are intending to say.
If something means something to you, it is important to you in some way.
If you describe someone as mean, you are being critical of them because they are unwilling to spend much money or to use very much of a particular thing.
If you describe an amount as mean, you are saying that it is very small.
"That's what Merlin must have meant when he said the future of Camelot depends on us," said Annie.

voca.means_ko:
[밋t]
만나다, 마중 가다, ~에 닿다/합류하다, 
(필요, 요구 등을) 충족시키다, (기한 등을) 지키다
지불하다
voca.means_en:
meet - met - met
If you meet someone, you happen to be in the same place as them and start talking to them. You may know the other person, but be surprised to see them, or you may not know them at all.
If two or more people meet, they go to the same place, which they have earlier arranged to do, so that they can talk or do something together.
If you meet someone, you are introduced to them and begin talking to them and getting to know them.
You use meet in expressions such as 'Pleased to meet you' and 'Nice to have met you' when you want to politely say hello or goodbye to someone you have just met for the first time.
If you meet someone off their train, plane, or bus, you go to the station, airport, or bus stop in order to be there when they arrive.
A meet is an event in which athletes come to a particular place in order to take part in a race or races.

to meet somebody by arrangement
to meet somebody by chance
to join up
Let's meet up at the movie theater at 7 p.m.

Your memory is your ability to remember things.
A memory is something that you remember from the past.
A computer's memory is the part of the computer where information is stored, especially for a short time before it is transferred to disks or magnetic tapes.
If you talk about the memory of someone who has died, especially someone who was loved or respected, you are referring to the thoughts, actions, and ceremonies by which they are remembered.
If you do something from memory, for example speak the words of a poem or play a piece of music, you do it without looking at it, because you know it very well.
If you say that something is, for example, the best, worst, or first thing of its kind in living memory, you are emphasizing that it is the only thing of that kind that people can remember.

voca.means_ko:
[^멘d]
수리하다, 고치다, 
(옷에난 구멍 등을) 꿰메다, 수선하다.
(문제, 불화 등을) 해결하다,
회복되다, 낫다
voca.means_en:
If you mend something that is broken or not working, you repair it, so that it works properly or can be used.
If a person or a part of their body mends or is mended, they get better after they have been ill or have had an injury.
If you try to mend divisions between people, you try to end the disagreements or quarrels between them.
If a relationship or situation is on the mend after a difficult or unsuccessful period, it is improving.
If you are on the mend after an illness or injury, you are recovering from it.
If someone who has been behaving badly mends their ways, they begin to behave well.
These must be their clothes. Maybe they're being mended.

Mental means relating to the process of thinking.
Mental means relating to the state or the health of a person's mind.
A mental act is one that involves only thinking and not physical action.
If you say that someone is mental, you mean that you think they are mad.
If you make a mental note of something, you make an effort to store it in your memory so that you will not forget it.

mention / refer to / cite / quote / allude to
If you mention something, you say something about it, usually briefly.
If someone is mentioned in writing, a reference is made to them by name, often to criticize or praise something that they have done.
If someone is mentioned as a candidate for something such as a job, it is suggested that they might become a candidate.
A mention is a reference to something or someone.
A special or honourable mention is formal praise that is given for an achievement that is very good, although not usually the best of its kind.
People sometimes say 'don't mention it' as a polite reply to someone who has just thanked them for doing something.
You use not to mention when you want to add extra information which emphasizes the point that you are making.

cheerful / bright / cheery / jolly / merry / in a good mood
If you describe someone's character or behaviour as merry, you mean that they are happy and cheerful.
If you get merry, you get slightly drunk.
Some people use merry to emphasize something that they are saying, often when they want to express disapproval or humour.
Just before Christmas and on Christmas Day, people say 'Merry Christmas' to other people to express the hope that they will have a happy time.

voca.means_ko: ~에게 심각한 정신적/정서적 문제를 안겨주다\n~에게 폭행을 가하다
voca.means_en:
to spoil somebody's life; to make somebody suffer emotionally or mentally
to physically hurt somebody, especially by hitting them
"Who messed it up, sir?" asked Annie.
A meteor is a piece of rock or metal that burns very brightly when it enters the earth's atmosphere from space.\n

Midnight is twelve o'clock in the middle of the night.
Midnight is used to describe something which happens or appears at midnight or in the middle of the night.
If someone is burning the midnight oil, they are staying up very late in order to study or do some other work.

voca.means_ko:
[마인d]
마음, 정신, 생각, 정신, 사고방식
언짢아하다, 상관하다, 개의하다
신경쓰다, 따르다, 기꺼이 ~을 하다
조심하다 (상대방에게 주의를 주거나 경고를 할 때 씀)
~의 말을 잘 듣다, ~에게 복종하다
voca.means_en:
You refer to someone's mind when talking about their thoughts. For example, if you say that something is in your mind, you mean that you are thinking about it, and if you say that something is at the back of your mind, you mean that you are aware of it, although you are not thinking about it very much.
Your mind is your ability to think and reason.
If you have a particular type of mind, you have a particular way of thinking which is part of your character, or a result of your education or professional training.
You can refer to someone as a particular kind of mind as a way of saying that they are clever, intelligent, or imaginative.

voca.means_ko:
[미^닛t]
(시간의) 분, 순간, 잠깐,
(정확한 어느) 순간
(각도 단위의) 분
미세한, 극미한, 아주 작은, 
대단히 상세한/세심한/철저한
voca.means_en:
A minute is one of the sixty parts that an hour is divided into. People often say 'a minute' or 'minutes' when they mean a short length of time.
The minutes of a meeting are the written records of the things that are discussed or decided at it.
When someone minutes something that is discussed or decided at a meeting, they make a written record of it.
People often use expressions such as wait a minute or just a minute when they want to stop you doing or saying something.
If you say that something is minute, you mean that it is very small.
modal verbs\nIn grammar, a modal or a modal auxiliary is a word such as 'can' or 'would' which is used with a main verb to express ideas such as possibility, intention, or necessity.\n

voca.means_ko:
[^마를]
(보통 실물보다 작게 만든) 모형
(상품의) 모델, 디자인
(남이 따라 할 만한) 본보기
훌륭한 사례, 모범, 시범
(모델로서 옷 등을) 입어 보이다
모형/견본을 만들다
voca.means_en:
A model of an object is a physical representation that shows what it looks like or how it works. The model is often smaller than the object it represents.
A model is a system that is being used and that people might want to copy in order to achieve similar results.
A model of a system or process is a theoretical description that can help you understand how the system or process works, or how it might work.
If you say that someone or something is a model of a particular quality, you are showing approval of them because they have that quality to a large degree.
A particular model of a machine is a particular version of it.
An artist's model is a person who stays still in a particular position so that the artist can make a picture or sculpture of them.

A pole is a long thin piece of wood or metal, used especially for supporting things.

The two poles of a range of qualities, opinions, or beliefs are the completely opposite qualities, opinions, or beliefs at either end of the range.

A policy is a set of ideas or plans that is used as a basis for making decisions, especially in politics, economics, or business.

Let's pop in a movie after dinner.\n

If you are in possession of something, you have it, because you have obtained it or because it belongs to you.

The pound is the unit of money which is used in Britain. It is represented by the symbol ￡. One British pound is divided into a hundred pence. Some other countries, for example Egypt, also have a unit of money called a pound.
The pound is used to refer to the British currency system, and sometimes to the currency systems of other countries which use pounds.
A pound is a unit of weight used mainly in Britain, America, and other countries where English is spoken. One pound is equal to 0.454 kilograms. A pound of something is a quantity of it that weighs one pound.A pound is a unit of weight used mainly in Britain, America, and other countries where English is spoken. One pound is equal to 0.454 kilograms. A pound of something is a quantity of it that weighs one pound.
Jack's heart pounded with excitement.
Boka was pounding a wide strip of bark with a wooden club.
"No!" shouted King Arthur, pounding his fists on the table.

Powder consists of many tiny particles of a solid substance.
Powder is very fine snow.
If a woman powders her face or some other part of her body, she puts face powder or talcum powder on it.
Sometimes Mr. Haney yelled at him for running through the halls. But he had been to the office only once-for putting sneezing powder on Mr. Ratburn's desk.

If someone has power, they have a lot of control over people and activities.

If it is in or within your power to do something, you are able to do it or you have the resources to deal with it.
If someone in authority has the power to do something, they have the legal right to do it.
If people take power or come to power, they take charge of a country's affairs. If a group of people are in power, they are in charge of a country's affairs.
You can use power to refer to a country that is very rich or important, or has strong military forces.
The device or fuel that powers a machine provides the energy that the machine needs in order to work.

A powerful person or organization is able to control or influence people and events.
You say that someone's body is powerful when it is physically strong.
A powerful machine or substance is effective because it is very strong.
A powerful smell is very strong.
A powerful voice is loud and can be heard from a long way away.

You can refer to something that people do regularly as a practice.
Practice means doing something regularly in order to be able to do it better. A practice is one of these periods of doing something.
The work done by doctors and lawyers is referred to as the practice of medicine and law. People's religious activities are referred to as the practice of a religion.
A doctor's or lawyer's practice is his or her business, often shared with other doctors or lawyers.
What happens in practice is what actually happens, in contrast to what is supposed to happen.
If something such as a procedure is normal practice or standard practice, it is the usual thing that is done in a particular situation.
A precaution is an action that is intended to prevent something dangerous or unpleasant from happening.\nPeople can get hurt or get sick, so they have to take precautions to be safe.\n

true / right / correct / exact / precise / accurate / spot on
You use precise to emphasize that you are referring to an exact thing, rather than something vague.

You say 'to be precise' to indicate that you are giving more detailed or accurate information than you have just given.

"Precisely," said Teddy.

A prescription is a medicine which a doctor has told you to take.

I'm going to write you a prescription.

voca.means_en:
actual / current / present
If you present someone with something such as a prize or document, or if you present it to them, you formally give it to them.
If something presents a difficulty, challenge, or opportunity, it causes it or provides it.
If an opportunity or problem presents itself, it occurs, often when you do not expect it.
When you present information, you give it to people in a formal way.
If you present someone or something in a particular way, you describe them in that way.
The way you present yourself is the way you speak and act when meeting new people.
If someone or something presents a particular appearance or image, that is how they appear or try to appear.
If you present yourself somewhere, you officially arrive there, for example for an appointment.
If someone presents a programme on television or radio, they introduce each item in it.
You use present to describe things and people that exist now, rather than those that existed in the past or those that may exist in the future.
In grammar, the present tenses of a verb are the ones that are used to talk about things that happen regularly or situations that exist at this time. The simple present tense uses the base form or the 's' form of a verb, as in 'I play tennis twice a week' and 'He works in a bank'.
The present is the period of time that we are in now and the things that are happening now.
"Allow me to present my knights," said King Arthur.

"Jack, look at those pretty fish with the teeth" said Annie.

If someone has a high profile, people notice them and what they do. If you keep a low profile, you avoid doing things that will make people notice you.

used when comparing or contrasting somebody/something with a group of other people or things to mean ‘combined' or ‘in total'\n

They told him he must send his knights on a quest to the Otherworld, to recapture our kingdom's joy.

If a place, situation, or time is quiet, there is no excitement, activity, or trouble.
If you are quiet, you are not saying anything.
If you refer, for example, to someone's quiet confidence or quiet despair, you mean that they do not say much about the way they are feeling.
You describe activities as quiet when they happen in secret or in such a way that people do not notice them.
Quiet is silence.
If someone or something quiets or if you quiet them, they become less noisy, less active, or silent.

in BRIT, usually use quieten

"After Mordred's Dark Wizard cast his spell, the king sought help from the magicians of Camelot," Morgan said quietly.\n

You use quite to emphasize what you are saying.
You use quite after a negative to make what you are saying weaker or less definite.
You can say 'quite' to express your agreement with someone.
You use quite in front of a noun group to emphasize that a person or thing is very impressive or unusual.

A quote for a piece of work is the price that someone says they will charge you to do the work.
Quotes are the same as quotation marks.
You can say 'quote' to show that you are about to quote someone's words.

Teddy's lantern shone on a brick oven, a stone hearth, baskets of apples, and strings of onions hanging from the rafters.\n

If the police raid a building, they enter it suddenly and by force in order to look for dangerous criminals or for evidence of something illegal, such as drugs or weapons.
If someone raids a building or place, they enter it by force in order to steal something.
If you raid the fridge or the larder, you take food from it to eat instead of a meal or in between meals.
"The ravens that came to this castle after raiding my treasure room," said the Raven King.

The rate at which something happens is the number of times it happens over a period of time.
A rate is the amount of money that is charged for goods or services.
The rate of taxation or interest is the amount of tax or interest that needs to be paid. It is expressed as a percentage of the amount that is earned, gained as profit, or borrowed.
If you rate someone or something as good or bad, you consider them to be good or bad. You can also say that someone or something rates as good or bad.
If you rate someone or something, you think that they are good.
If someone or something is rated at a particular position or rank, they are calculated or considered to be in that position on a list.
If you say that someone or something rates a particular reaction, you mean that this is the reaction you consider to be appropriate.
You use at any rate to indicate that what you have just said might be incorrect or unclear in some way, and that you are now being more precise.
You use at any rate to indicate that the important thing is what you are saying now, and not what was said before.
If you say that at this rate something bad or extreme will happen, you mean that it will happen if things continue to develop as they have been doing.

You use rather to indicate that something is true to a fairly great extent, especially when you are talking about something unpleasant or undesirable.

Red and yellow leaves rattled in the cool breeze.
As they started through the woods, a warm wind blew, rattling the leaves.

If you can reach something, you are able to touch it by stretching out your arm or leg.

If something reaches a place, point, or level, it extends as far as that place, point, or level.
When people reach an agreement or a decision, they succeed in achieving it.

When you read a piece of writing to someone, you say the words aloud.
People who can read have the ability to look at and understand written words.
If you can read music, you have the ability to look at and understand the symbols that are used in written music to represent musical sounds.
When a computer reads a file or a document, it takes information from a disk or tape.
You can use read when saying what is written on something or in something. For example, if a notice reads 'Entrance', the word 'Entrance' is written on it.

voca.means_en:
You can use really to emphasize a statement.
You can use really to emphasize an adjective or adverb.
You use really when you are discussing the real facts about something, in contrast to the ones someone wants you to believe.
People use really in questions and negative statements when they want you to answer 'no'.
If you refer to a time when something really begins to happen, you are emphasizing that it starts to happen at that time to a much greater extent and much more seriously than before.
People sometimes use really to slightly reduce the force of a negative statement.
You can say really to express surprise or disbelief at what someone has said.

You can use realm to refer to any area of activity, interest, or thought.
A realm is a country that has a king or queen.
If you say that something is not beyond the realms of possibility, you mean that it is possible.
Soon you will be called upon to use your knowledge of Everyday Magic in the realm of fantasy.
They invite you to come with them to an outlying realm of Camelot where strange and eerie things are happening at a duke's castle.

voca.means_ko: 반역하다, 반란을 일으키다, 반항하다\n반역자, 반항자\n반항하는, 반역의
voca.means_en:
Rebels are people who are fighting against their own country's army in order to change the political system there.
Politicians who oppose some of their own party's policies can be referred to as rebels.
You can say that someone is a rebel if you think that they behave differently from other people and have rejected the values of society or of their parents.

voca.means_en:
When soldiers recapture an area of land or a place, they gain control of it again from an opposing army who had taken it from them.
When people recapture something that they have lost to a competitor, they get it back again.
To recapture a person or animal which has escaped from somewhere means to catch them again.
When you recapture something such as an experience, emotion, or a quality that you had in the past, you experience it again. When something recaptures an experience for you, it makes you remember it.
They told him he must send his knights on a quest to the Otherworld, to recapture our kingdom's joy.

voca.means_en:
The reception in a hotel is the desk or office that books rooms for people and answers their questions.
The reception in an office or hospital is the place where people's appointments and questions are dealt with.
A reception is a formal party which is given to welcome someone or to celebrate a special event.
If someone or something has a particular kind of reception, that is the way that people react to them
If you get good reception from your radio or television, the sound or picture is clear because the signal is strong. If the reception is poor, the sound or picture is unclear because the signal is weak.

voca.means_en:
A recess is a break between the periods of work of an official body such as a committee, a court of law, or a government.
In a room, a recess is part of a wall which is built further back than the rest of the wall. Recesses are often used as a place to put furniture such as shelves.
The recesses of something or somewhere are the parts of it which are hard to see because light does not reach them or they are hidden from view.
If you refer to the recesses of someone's mind or soul, you are referring to thoughts or feelings they have which are hidden or difficult to describe.
When formal meetings or court cases recess, they stop temporarily.
George: Oh I'd like to get Lisa's recipe for her Chinese chicken salad. I like it.\n

voca.means_ko: (건강, 경제 등의) 회복, \n(분실물 등을) 되찾음\n(수술받은 환자를 눕혀 놓는) 회복실
voca.means_en:
If a sick person makes a recovery, he or she becomes well again.
When there is a recovery in a country's economy, it improves.
You talk about the recovery of something when you get it back after it has been lost or stolen.
You talk about the recovery of someone's physical or mental state when they return to this state.
If someone is in recovery, they are being given a course of treatment to help them recover from something such as a drug habit or mental illness.

알아채다, 기억하다, 인식되다, 기억나다

voca.means_en:
A register is an official list or record of people or things.
In linguistics, the register of a piece of speech or writing is its level and style of language, which is usually appropriate to the situation or circumstances in which it is used.
If you register to do something, you put your name on an official list, in order to be able to do that thing or to receive a service.
If you register something, such as the name of a person who has just died or information about something you own, you have these facts recorded on an official list.
When something registers on a scale or measuring instrument, it shows on the scale or instrument. You can also say that something registers a certain amount or level on a scale or measuring instrument.
If you register your feelings or opinions about something, you do something that makes them clear to other people.
If a feeling registers on someone's face, their expression shows clearly that they have that feeling.
If a piece of information does not register or if you do not register it, you do not really pay attention to it, and so you do not remember it or react to it.

등록 서류
voca.means_en: The registration of something such as a person's name or the details of an event is the recording of it in an official list.\nJohn: Yes. We have two classes with very low registration and attendance.\n

voca.means_en:
Reins are the thin leather straps attached round a horse's neck which are used to control the horse.
Journalists sometimes use the expression the reins or the reins of power to refer to the control of a country or organization.
If you give free rein to someone, you give them a lot of freedom to do what they want.
If you keep a tight rein on someone, you control them firmly.

voca.means_en:
If you reject something such as a proposal, a request, or an offer, you do not accept it or you do not agree to it.
If you reject a belief or a political system, you refuse to believe in it or to live by its rules.
If someone is rejected for a job or course of study, it is not offered to them.
If someone rejects another person who expects affection from them, they are cold and unfriendly towards them.
If a person's body rejects something such as a new heart that has been transplanted into it, it tries to attack and destroy it.
If a machine rejects a coin that you put in it, the coin comes out and the machine does not work.
A reject is a product that has not been accepted for use or sale, because there is something wrong with it.

If you repair something that has been damaged or is not working properly, you mend it.
If you repair a relationship or someone's reputation after it has been damaged, you do something to improve it.
A repair is something that you do to mend a machine, building, piece of clothing, or other thing that has been damaged or is not working properly.

voca.means_ko: [뤠쁴뤼제니티v]\n대표(자), 대리인, (미국) 하원 의원\n대표하는, 전형적인, 대표적인 사례가 되는
voca.means_en:
A representative is a person who has been chosen to act or make decisions on behalf of another person or a group of people.
A representative is a person whose job is to sell a company's products or services, especially by travelling round and visiting other companies.
In the United States, a Representative is a member of the House of Representatives, the less powerful of the two parts of Congress.
A representative group consists of a small number of people who have been chosen to make decisions on behalf of a larger group.
Someone who is typical of the group to which they belong can be described as representative.

To have a reputation for something means to be known or remembered for it.
Something's or someone's reputation is the opinion that people have about how good they are. If they have a good reputation, people think they are good.
If you know someone by reputation, you have never met them but you have heard of their reputation.
The hyena has a reputation for being a thief and a coward.

If someone reschedules an event, they change the time at which it is supposed to happen.
To reschedule a debt means to arrange for the person, organization, or country that owes money to pay it back over a longer period because they are in financial difficulty.
We rescheduled for another day.
Can we reschedule our meeting?
It's very rude to reschedule a blind date.

save / rescue / bail out / redeem
If you rescue someone, you get them out of a dangerous or unpleasant situation.
Rescue is help which gets someone out of a dangerous or unpleasant situation.
A rescue is an attempt to save someone from a dangerous or unpleasant situation.
If you go to someone's rescue or come to their rescue, you help them when they are in danger or difficulty.

voca.means_en: The resources of an organization or person are the materials, money, and other things that they have and can use in order to function properly.\nA country's resources are the things that it has and can use to increase its wealth, such as coal, oil, or land.\n

voca.means_en:
If you respect someone, you have a good opinion of their character or ideas.
If you respect someone's wishes, rights, or customs, you avoid doing things that they would dislike or regard as wrong.
If you respect a law or moral principle, you agree not to break it.
If you have respect for someone, you have a good opinion of them.
If you show respect for someone's wishes, rights, or customs, you avoid doing anything they would dislike or regard as wrong.
You can say with respect when you are politely disagreeing with someone or criticizing them.
If you pay your respects to someone, you go to see them or speak to them. You usually do this to be polite, and not necessarily because you want to do it.

voca.means_en:
If someone or something is responsible for a particular event or situation, they are the cause of it or they can be blamed for it.
If you are responsible for something, it is your job or duty to deal with it and make decisions relating to it.
If you are responsible to a person or group, they have authority over you and you have to report to them about what you do.
Responsible people behave properly and sensibly, without needing to be supervised.
Responsible jobs involve making important decisions or carrying out important tasks.
B : He is very organized and responsible.

voca.means_en:
If you rest or if you rest your body, you do not do anything active for a time.
If something such as a theory or someone's success rests on a particular thing, it depends on that thing.
A rest is an object that is used to support something, especially your head, arms, or feet.
Finally they rested against a giant rock.

return / come back / go back / get back / turn back
When you return to a place, you go back there after you have been away.
If you return something that you have borrowed or taken, you give it back or put it back.
If you return something somewhere, you put it back where it was.
If you return someone's action, you do the same thing to them as they have just done to you. If you return someone's feeling, you feel the same way towards them as they feel towards you.
If a feeling or situation returns, it comes back or happens again after a period when it was not present.
The return on an investment is the profit that you get from it.
Your return is your arrival back at a place where you had been before.
We must return these rare books to her library.

voca.means_ko: 저 연락한 사람에게 연락을 취하다\n답례 전화를 하다
voca.means_en: I'll return his call later.\nMike: Laura why didn't you return my call?\n

시를 짓다
voca.means_en:
If one word rhymes with another or if two words rhyme, they have a very similar sound. Words that rhyme with each other are often used in poems.
If a poem or song rhymes, the lines end with words that have very similar sounds.
A rhyme is a word which rhymes with another word, or a set of lines which rhyme.
A rhyme is a short poem which has rhyming words at the ends of its lines.
Rhyme is the use of rhyming words as a technique in poetry. If something is written in rhyme, it is written as a poem in which the lines rhyme.
His spirits sank. Except for the three rhymes, he'd taken no notes on their journey-not one.
"But a warning, my boy: you are hasty and careless with your magic rhymes.
I can come up with better rhymes than him anyway.

Your ribs are the 12 pairs of curved bones that surround your chest.
A rib of meat such as beef or pork is a piece that has been cut to include one of the animal's ribs.
If you rib someone about something, you tease them about it in a friendly way.

voca.means_en: You say 'good riddance' to indicate that you are pleased that someone has left or that something has gone.\n
to be heard loudly and clearly\nThe knight's voice rang out from inside his helmet.\n

Ripples are little waves on the surface of water caused by the wind or by something moving in or on the water.
If an event causes ripples, its effects gradually spread, causing several other events to happen one after the other.
When the surface of an area of water ripples or when something ripples it, a number of little waves appear on it.
If something such as a feeling ripples over someone's body, it moves across it or through it.

voca.means_en:
rise / raise
If something rises, it moves upwards
When you rise, you stand up.
When you rise, you get out of bed.
When the sun or moon rises, it appears in the sky.
You can say that something rises when it appears as a large tall shape.
If the level of something such as the water in a river rises, it becomes higher.
If land rises, it slopes upwards.
If an amount rises, it increases.
If the wind rises, it becomes stronger.
If a sound rises or if someone's voice rises, it becomes louder or higher.
When the people in a country rise, they try to defeat the government or army that is controlling them.
If someone rises to a higher position or status, they become more important, successful, or powerful.
A rise in the amount of something is an increase in it.
A rise is an increase in your wages or your salary.
The rise of a movement or activity is an increase in its popularity or influence.
The rise of someone is the process by which they become more important, successful, or powerful.

voca.means_ko:
[^로어r]
(큰 짐승이) 으르렁 거리다, 고함치다, 크게 웃다
굉음을 내며 질주하다, 맹렬히 타오르다
(특히 사자의) 으르렁 거림/포효, 고함, 아우성, 울부짓음
voca.means_en:
If something, usually a vehicle, roars somewhere, it goes there very fast, making a loud noise.
If something roars, it makes a very loud noise.
If someone roars with laughter, they laugh in a very noisy way.
"Who cares?" roared Cap'n Bones.
The water roared as it raced downhill. / The cat roared and spun around.
The woolly mammoth roared and plunged forward.
A loud roar filled Jack's ears.
The fire roared!
When they stepped onto the ground, there was a great roar above them.
Suddenly he heard a roar.
There was a mighty roar and a flash of light and a blast of heat!
A deafening wind roared through the room.
There was a mighty roar, a blast of heat, and a blaze of light!

voca.means_en:
If you rub a part of your body, you move your hand or fingers backwards and forwards over it while pressing firmly.
If you rub against a surface or rub a part of your body against a surface, you move it backwards and forwards while pressing it against the surface.
If you rub an object or a surface, you move a cloth backward and forward over it in order to clean or dry it.
If you rub a substance into a surface or rub something such as dirt from a surface, you spread it over the surface or remove it from the surface using your hand or something such as a cloth.
Rub is used in expressions such as there's the rub and the rub is when you are mentioning a difficulty that makes something hard or impossible to achieve.
He rubbed his nose. / He rubbed his eyes.
He took the rope off his foot and rubbed his ankle.

voca.means_en:
A rug is a piece of thick material that you put on a floor. It is like a carpet but covers a smaller area.
A rug is a small blanket which you use to cover your shoulders or your knees to keep them warm.
If someone pulls the rug from under a person or thing or pulls the rug from under someone's feet, they stop giving their help or support.

voca.means_ko: (가능하거나 적절하지 않다고) ~을 배제하다\n(~ 하지 못하도록) ~을 제외시키다

흐르다, 붓다, 흘리다, (물 등이) 뒤덮다

voca.means_en:
run - ran - run
When you run, you move more quickly than when you walk, for example because you are in a hurry to get somewhere, or for exercise.
When someone runs in a race, they run in competition with other people.
When a horse runs in a race or when its owner runs it, it competes in a race.
If you say that something long, such as a road, runs in a particular direction, you are describing its course or position. You can also say that something runs the length or width of something else.
If you run a wire or tube somewhere, you fix it or pull it from, to, or across a particular place.
If you run your hand or an object through something, you move your hand or the object through it.
If you run something through a machine, process, or series of tests, you make it go through the machine, process, or tests.
If someone runs for office in an election, they take part as a candidate.
If you run something such as a business or an activity, you are in charge of it or you organize it.
If you talk about how a system, an organization, or someone's life is running, you are saying how well it is operating or progressing.
If you run an experiment, computer program, or other process, or start it running, you start it and let it continue.

voca.means_ko: 다하다, 만기가 되다, \n부족하다, 나가다, 끝까지 해내다
voca.means_en:
if a supply of something runs out, it is finished or used up
The keepers' blue flames grew weaker and weaker, as if they were running out of fuel.
Tracey: This pen ran out of ink. Do you have another one?

Rung is the past participle of ring.
The rungs on a ladder are the wooden or metal bars that form the steps.
If you reach a particular rung in your career, in an organization, or in a process, you reach that level in it.
His feet didn't touch the rungs of the ladder.
My head's stuffed up. I've got a runny nose, and I'm aching all over. \n

voca.means_ko:
