voca.means_en:
A wish is a desire or strong feeling that you want to have something or do something.
If you express your good wishes towards someone, you are politely expressing your friendly feelings towards them and your hope that they will be successful or happy.
If you wish to do something or to have it done for you, you want to do it or have it done.
If you wish something were true, you would like it to be true, even though you know that it is impossible or unlikely.
If you wish for something, you express the desire for that thing silently to yourself. In fairy stories, when a person wishes for something, the thing they wish for often happens by magic.
If you say that you would not wish a particular thing on someone, you mean that the thing is so unpleasant that you would not want them to be forced to experience it.
If you wish someone something such as luck or happiness, you express the hope that they will be lucky or happy.

voca.means_en:
Wit is the ability to use words or ideas in an amusing, clever, and imaginative way.
If you describe someone as a wit, you mean that they have the ability to use words or ideas in an amusing, clever, and imaginative way.
If you say that someone has the wit to do something, you mean that they have the intelligence and understanding to make the right decision or take the right action in a particular situation.
You can refer to your ability to think quickly and cleverly in a difficult situation as your wits.
You can use wits in expressions such as frighten someone out of their wits and scare the wits out of someone to emphasize that a person or thing worries or frightens someone very much.
If you have your wits about you or keep your wits about you, you are alert and ready to act in a difficult situation
If you say that you are at your wits' end, you are emphasizing that you are so worried and exhausted by problems or difficulties that you do not know what to do next.
"Two weeks ago, she went to the castle as usual. But she came running back, scared out of her wits."

without delaying; immediately.\nSo without further ado, let's get on with tonight's show.\n

If you refer, for example, to a young man as a wonder boy, or to a new product as a wonder drug, you mean that they are believed by many people to be very good or very effective.

The worst is the most unpleasant or unfavourable thing that could happen or does happen.

If something is worth a particular amount of money, it can be sold for that amount or is considered to have that value.
If you say that something is worth having, you mean that it is pleasant or useful, and therefore a good thing to have.
If something is worth a particular action, or if an action is worth doing, it is considered to be important enough for that action.
Worth combines with amounts of money, so that when you talk about a particular amount of money's worth of something, you mean the quantity of it that you can buy for that amount of money.
Worth combines with time expressions, so you can use worth when you are saying how long an amount of something will last. For example, a week's worth of food is the amount of food that will last you for a week.
Someone's worth is the value, usefulness, or importance that they are considered to have.

If you are wounded by what someone says or does, your feelings are deeply hurt.

voca.means_en:
already / just / yet
You use yet in negative statements to indicate that something has not happened up to the present time, although it probably will happen. You can also use yet in questions to ask if something has happened up to the present time. In British English the simple past tense is not normally used with this meaning of 'yet'.
You use yet with a negative statement when you are talking about the past, to report something that was not the case then, although it became the case later.
If you say that something should not or cannot be done yet, you mean that it should not or cannot be done now, although it will have to be done at a later time.
You use yet after a superlative to indicate, for example, that something is the worst or the best of its kind up to the present time.
You can use yet after expressions which refer to a period of time, when you want to say how much longer a situation will continue for.
If you say that you have yet to do something, you mean that you have never done it, especially when this is surprising or bad.

When you wrap something, you fold paper or cloth tightly round it to cover it completely, for example in order to protect it or so that you can give it to someone as a present.
When you wrap something such as a piece of paper or cloth round another thing, you put it around it.
If someone wraps their arms, fingers, or legs around something, they put them firmly around it.

If you keep something under wraps, you keep it secret, often until you are ready to announce it at some time in the future.

to put warm clothes, etc. on yourself/somebody
We will wrap up the deal with Sony tomorrow.
A : The meeting should be wrapping up in a few minutes.

To advance an event, or the time or date of an event, means to bring it forward to an earlier time or date.
If you advance a cause, interest, or claim, you support it and help to make it successful.
An advance is money which is lent or paid to someone before they would normally receive it.
An advance is a forward movement of people or vehicles, usually as part of a military operation.

An ass is an animal which is related to a horse but which is smaller and has long ears.
If you describe someone as an ass, you think that they are silly or do silly things.
Your ass is your bottom.
Saying that someone can kiss your ass is a very rude way of expressing anger or disagreement.
If one person calls another person an asshole, they think that person is extremely stupid or has behaved in a stupid way.\n

A broom is a kind of brush with a long handle. You use a broom for sweeping the floor.
Broom is a wild bush with a lot of tiny yellow flowers.
Jack caught sight of a straw broom in the corner.
Jack dropped his broom and whirled around.

To bury something means to put it into a hole in the ground and cover it up with earth.
To bury a dead person means to put their body into a grave and cover it with earth.
If someone says they have buried one of their relatives, they mean that one of their relatives has died.
If you bury something under a large quantity of things, you put it there, often in order to hide it.
If something buries a place or person, it falls on top of them so that it completely covers them and often harms them in some way.
If you bury your head or face in something, you press your head or face against it, often because you are unhappy.
He found a picture of pirate burying a treasure chest.
Jake buried his face in his hands.

When you are busy, you are working hard or concentrating on a task, so that you are not free to do anything else.
A busy time is a period of time during which you have a lot of things to do.
If you say that someone is busy thinking or worrying about something, you mean that it is taking all their attention, often to such an extent that they are unable to think about anything else.
A busy place is full of people who are doing things or moving about.
When a telephone line is busy, you cannot make your call because the line is already being used by someone else.
If you busy yourself with something, you occupy yourself by dealing with it.
discussion / conversation / dialogue / talk / consultation / chat / gossip\nWhen people chat, they talk to each other in an informal and friendly way.\n
A composite object or item is made up of several different things, parts, or substances.\n

voca.means_en:
If you decide to do something, you choose to do it, usually after you have thought carefully about the other possibilities.
If a person or group of people decides something, they choose what something should be like or how a particular problem should be solved.
If an event or fact decides something, it makes it certain that a particular choice will be made or that there will be a particular result.
If you decide that something is true, you form that opinion about it after considering the facts.

If you disturb someone, you interrupt what they are doing and upset them.
If something disturbs you, it makes you feel upset or worried.
If something is disturbed, its position or shape is changed.
If something disturbs a situation or atmosphere, it spoils it or causes trouble.
I don't want to disturb her.

A doorway is a space in a wall where a door opens and closes.
A doorway is a covered space just outside the door of a building.
Annie was peering through a doorway off the hall.
A giant, slimy, mud-colored creature crawled out throught on of the doorways.
He held out his hand and waved Jack and Annie through the open doorway.

voca.means_en: A driveway is a piece of hard ground that leads from the road to the front of a house or other building.\n
I have to carefully look at the menu. Even then, I have no way of knowing whether I will like a dish.\n

voca.means_en:
demand / require / expect / insist / ask
If you expect something to happen, you believe that it will happen.
If you are expecting something or someone, you believe that they will be delivered to you or come to you soon, often because this has been arranged earlier.
If you expect something, or expect a person to do something, you believe that it is your right to have that thing, or the person's duty to do it for you.
If you tell someone not to expect something, you mean that the thing is unlikely to happen as they have planned or imagined, and they should not hope that it will.
How does she expect us to get there?
For instance, when I go to my favorite fast food joint, I always order the same combo menu.\n

A : Yes. I think I need a change for once.\n
A gathering is a group of people meeting together for a particular purpose.\nIf there is gathering darkness, the light is gradually decreasing, usually because it is nearly night.\n

Searching for a gathering place has become easier.
We all met at the gathering place.
Can you tell me where the gathering place is?

It was harder to get in touch with people.
I will get in touch with you later.
I got in touch with an old friend back from school.

I have no way of knowing whether I will like a dish.
I have no way of knowing my test score.
She had no way of knowing how long it woul take.

The menu changes depending on the ingredients in season.
She made a salad with vegetables that were in season.
I always ask what fruits are in season.

voca.means_en:
Ingredients are the things that are used to make something, especially all the different foods you use when you are cooking a particular dish.

The ingredients were turned into a delicious dish.
Some places even have a changing menu, depending on the ingredients in season.

In a fight or contest, if you have the initiative, you are in a better position than your opponents to decide what to do next.
If you have initiative, you have the ability to decide what to do next and to do it, without needing other people to tell you what to do.
If you take the initiative in a situation, you are the first person to act, and are therefore able to control the situation.

If you insure yourself or your property, you pay money to an insurance company so that, if you become ill or if your property is damaged or stolen, the company will pay you a sum of money.\nIf you insure yourself against something unpleasant that might happen in the future, you do something to protect yourself in case it happens, or to prevent it happening.\n

I know in advance what I'm going to get.
I knew in advance where I wanted to go for my vacation.
She always knows in advance what she will buy.

If you lay something such as carpets, cables, or foundations, you put them into their permanent position.
To lay a trap means to prepare it in order to catch someone or something.
When a female bird lays an egg, it produces an egg by pushing it out of its body.
Lay is used with some nouns to talk about making official preparations for something. For example, if you lay the basis for something or lay plans for it, you prepare it carefully.
Lay is used with some nouns in expressions about accusing or blaming someone. For example, if you lay the blame for a mistake on someone, you say it is their fault, or if the police lay charges against someone, they officially accuse that person of a crime.
His cape lay on the floor.

in danger of failing or being destroyed
served with ice but no water
Bartender: Would you like your whisky on the rocks?
In the past, organizing a gathering was quite difficult. It was harder to get in touch with people.\n
The outskirts of a city or town are the parts of it that are farthest away from its centre.\nThey live on the outskirts of Chicago.\n
A pantry is a small room or large cupboard in a house, usually near the kitchen, where food is kept.\n

If you are polled on something, you are asked what you think about it as part of a survey.
If a political party or a candidate polls a particular number or percentage of votes, they get that number or percentage of votes in an election.

A purse is a small bag that women carry.
Purse is used to refer to the total amount of money that a country, family, or group has.
If you purse your lips, you move them into a small, rounded shape, usually because you disapprove of something or when you are thinking.

If you keep a record of something, you keep a written account or photographs of it so that it can be referred to later.
A record is a round, flat piece of black plastic on which sound, especially music, is stored, and which can be played on a record player. You can also refer to the music stored on this piece of plastic as a record.
A record is the best result that has ever been achieved in a particular sport or activity, for example the fastest time, the furthest distance, or the greatest number of victories.
Someone's record is the facts that are known about their achievements or character.
If someone has a criminal record, it is officially known that they have committed crimes in the past.
If you record a piece of information or an event, you write it down, photograph it, or put it into a computer so that in the future people can refer to it.
If you record something such as a speech or performance, you put it on tape or film so that it can be heard or seen again later.
If a musician or performer records a piece of music or a television or radio show, they perform it so that it can be put onto CD, tape, or film.

examine / review / study / take stock / survey
A review of a situation or system is its formal examination by people in authority. This is usually done in order to see whether it can be improved or corrected.
A review is a report in the media in which someone gives their opinion of something such as a new book or film.
If you review a situation or system, you consider it carefully to see what is wrong with it or how it could be improved.
If someone reviews something such as a new book or film, they write a report or give a talk on television or radio in which they express their opinion of it.
When you review for an examination, you read things again and make notes in order to be prepared for the examination.

If you rinse your mouth, you wash it by filling your mouth with water or with a liquid that kills germs, then spitting it out.

voca.means_en:
The seasons are the main periods into which a year can be divided and which each have their own typical weather conditions.
You can use season to refer to the period during each year when a particular activity or event takes place. For example, the planting season is the period when a particular plant or crop is planted.
You can use season to refer to the period when a particular fruit, vegetable, or other food is ready for eating and is widely available.
You can use season to refer to a fixed period during each year when a particular sport is played.
A season is a period in which a play or show, or a series of plays or shows, is performed in one place.
A season of films is several of them shown as a series because they are connected in some way.
The holiday or vacation season is the time when most people have their holiday.
If you season food with salt, pepper, or spices, you add them to it in order to improve its flavour.
If wood is seasoned, it is made suitable for making into furniture or for burning, usually by being allowed to dry out gradually.

Your signature is your name, written in your own characteristic way, often at the end of a document to indicate that you wrote the document or that you agree with what it says.\nA signature item is typical of or associated with a particular person.\n

I usually get the restaurant's signature dish.
What is the signature dish here?
I cooked my signature dish for my guests.

voca.means_en: If you say that someone or something is silly, you mean that they are foolish, childish, or ridiculous.\n

Something that is soft is pleasant to touch, and not rough or hard.
Something that is soft changes shape or bends easily when you press it.
Something that has a soft appearance has smooth curves rather than sharp or distinct edges.
Something that is soft is very gentle and has no force. For example, a soft sound or voice is quiet and not harsh. A soft light or colour is pleasant to look at because it is not bright.
If you are soft on someone, you do not treat them as strictly or severely as you should do.
If you say that someone has a soft heart, you mean that they are sensitive and sympathetic towards other people.
“Hello!” Arthur called out softly.\n
You can refer to an amount of food resting on a spoon as a spoonful of food.\n

Spots are small, round, coloured areas on a surface. / You can refer to a particular place as a spot.
Spots on a person's skin are small lumps or marks. / A spot of a liquid is a small amount of it.
If you have a spot of something, you have a small amount of it.
A spot in a television or radio show is a part of it that is regularly reserved for a particular performer or type of entertainment.
They saw two spotted brown animals standing in the tall grass.

voca.means_en:
If something spouts liquid or fire, or if liquid or fire spout out of something, it comes out very quickly with a lot of force.
If you say that a person spouts something, you disapprove of them because they say something which you do not agree with or which you think they do not honestly feel.
A spout of liquid is a long stream of it which is coming out of something very forcefully.
A spout is a long, hollow part of a container through which liquids can be poured out easily.

certain / bound / sure / definite / as sured
If you are sure that something is true, you are certain that it is true. If you are not sure about something, you do not know for certain what the true situation is.
If someone is sure of getting something, they will definitely get it or they think they will definitely get it.
Sure is used to emphasize that something such as a sign or ability is reliable or accurate.
If you tell someone to be sure to do something, you mean that they must not forget to do it.

One person had to take the initiative.
I like to take the initiative.
If you're ot satisfied, you should take the initiative.

although / even though / though
You use though to introduce a statement in a subordinate clause which contrasts with the statement in the main clause. You often use though to introduce a fact which you regard as less important than the fact in the main clause.
ou use though to introduce a subordinate clause which gives some information that is relevant to the main clause and weakens the force of what it is saying.
You use though to indicate that the information in a clause contrasts with or modifies information given in a previous sentence or sentences.
You can say though I say so myself or even though I say it myself when you are praising yourself or something you have done, but do not want to sound too proud.
Though he still sounded hoarse, the knight's deep voice carried an amazing strength.
If an event or someone's behaviour is unexpected, it surprises you because you did not think that it was likely to happen.\n

When a dog wags its tail, it repeatedly waves its tail from side to side.
If you wag your finger, you shake it repeatedly and quickly from side to side, usually because you are annoyed with someone.
If you wag your head, you move it from side to side, often because you are unhappy about a situation.

complain / protest / object / grumble / moan / whine / whinge
If something or someone whines, they make a long, high-pitched noise, especially one which sounds sad or unpleasant.
If you say that someone is whining, you mean that they are complaining in an annoying way about something unimportant.
whined and yelped

If you decide to give an activity a whirl, you do it even though it is something that you have never tried before.
"Where is it?" said Jack, whirling around.
Not only was his body missing, but the fog beneath the bridge was moving in a wild, spinning whirl.

artificial / synthetic / false / man-made / fake / imitation
Artificial objects, materials, or processes do not occur naturally and are created by human beings, for example using science or technology.
An artificial state or situation exists only because someone has created it, and therefore often seems unnatural or unnecessary.
If you describe someone or their behaviour as artificial, you disapprove of them because they pretend to have attitudes and feelings which they do not really have.
In the past, restaurants did everything they could to make the food taste good. They used a lot of sugar and artificial seasoning.\n

voca.means_en: A bogeyman is someone whose ideas or actions are disapproved of by some people, and who is described by them as evil or unpleasant in order to make other people afraid.\nA bogeyman is an imaginary evil spirit. Some parents tell their children that the bogeyman will catch them if they behave badly.\n

voca.means_en: Calories are units used to measure the energy value of food. People who are on diets try to eat food that does not contain many calories.\n

특별한 관심이 있는
voca.means_en:
If you are conscious of something, you notice it or realize that it is happening.
If you are conscious of something, you think about it a lot, especially because you are unhappy about it or because you think it is important.
A conscious decision or action is made or done deliberately with you giving your full attention to it.
Someone who is conscious is awake rather than asleep or unconscious.
Conscious memories or thoughts are ones that you are aware of.

voca.means_ko:
[^카운t]
(올바른 순서로 수를) 세다, 계산하다, 생각하다
(정식으로) 인정하다, 인정되다
계산, 셈, 총계
기소항목, 죄목
voca.means_en:
When you count, you say all the numbers one after another up to a particular number.
If you count all the things in a group, you add them up in order to find how many there are.
If something or someone counts for something or counts, they are important or valuable.
A count is the action of counting a particular set of things, or the number that you get when you have counted them.
You use count when referring to the level or amount of something that someone or something has.

People count calories when ordering at restaurants.
You won't enjoy your food if you keep counting calories.
If you want to lose weight, you should start counting calories.
In the past, restaurants did everything they could to make the food taste good. They used a lot of sugar and artificial seasoning.\n
A duct is a pipe, tube, or channel which carries a liquid or gas.\nA duct is a tube in your body which carries a liquid such as tears or bile.\n

voca.means_ko:
[^담]
벙어리의, 말을 못하는, 
침묵시키다, 침묵하다
멍청한, 바보같은, 우둔한, 어리석은
voca.means_en:
Someone who is dumb is completely unable to speak.
If someone is dumb on a particular occasion, they cannot speak because they are angry, shocked, or surprised.
If you call a person dumb, you mean that they are stupid or foolish.
If you say that something is dumb, you think that it is silly and annoying.
"It's just a dumb old envelope. People could walk by this envelope for weeks and not even notice it. And even if they did notice it, they wouldn't bother to open a boring envelope like this."\n

cheat / fool / deceive / betray / take in / trick / con
If you call someone a fool, you are indicating that you think they are not at all sensible and show a lack of good judgment.
Fool is used to describe an action or person that is not at all sensible and shows a lack of good judgment.
If someone fools you, they deceive or trick you.
If you say that a person is fooling with something or someone, you mean that the way they are behaving is likely to cause problems.

If you forbid someone to do something, or if you forbid an activity, you order that it must not be done.\nIf something forbids a particular course of action or state of affairs, it makes it impossible for the course of action or state of affairs to happen.\n

voca.means_ko:
[^p뤈t]
(사물의) 앞면, 앞부분, 정면

앞부분의, 중요한
(어떤 방향으로) 향하다/면하다, 
(조직, 단체를) 이끌다, 대표하다
voca.means_en:
The front of something is the part of it that faces you, or that faces forward, or that you normally see or use.
The front of a building is the side or part of it that faces the street.
A person's or animal's front is the part of their body between their head and their legs that is on the opposite side to their back.
In a war, the front is a line where two opposing armies are facing each other.
If you say that something is happening on a particular front, you mean that it is happening with regard to a particular situation or field of activity.
Front is used to refer to the side or part of something that is towards the front or nearest to the front.
A building or an area of land that fronts a particular place or fronts onto it is next to it and faces it.

People try to eat healthy even when they go out to eat.
We go out to eat every weekend.
He goes out to eat when he's too busy to cook.

People are much more health-conscious than in the past.
I am health-conscious, but I don't have time to exercise.
My family members are very health-conscious.
Now, they promote the health benefits of their dishes. Healthiness has become a major selling point.\n

capable of being transmitted by heredity from one generation to a later one
capable of being inherited
capable of inheriting; having the right to inherit

voca.means_ko:
[이^뤠귤뤄r]
고르지 못한, 가지런하지 못한,
(시간적 간격이) 불규칙한, 
변칙적인, 비정상적인
비정규의
voca.means_en:
If events or actions occur at irregular intervals, the periods of time between them are of different lengths.
Something that is irregular is not smooth or straight, or does not form a regular pattern.
Irregular behaviour is dishonest or not in accordance with the normal rules.
An irregular verb, noun, or adjective has different forms from most other verbs, nouns, or adjectives in the
They count calories when ordering at restaurants. They keep their health in mind even when they go out to eat.\n

voca.means_ko:
[리이-v]
(사람, 장소에서) 떠나다, 출발하다
(살던 집, 직장, 학교 등을) 떠나다, 그만두다
(어떤 결과를] 남기다, 남아있다
(남기고 떠나다)
허가, (유급)휴가
voca.means_en:
leave - left - left
If you leave a place or person, you go away from that place or person.
If you leave an institution, group, or job, you permanently stop attending that institution, being a member of that group, or doing that job.
If you leave your husband, wife, or some other person with whom you have had a close relationship, you stop living with them or you finish the relationship.
To leave someone with something, especially when that thing is unpleasant or difficult to deal with, means to make them have it or make them responsible for it.
We say aloha when we greet our friends. And we say aloha when we leave them.

voca.means_ko:
[^럼p]
덩어리, 각설탕, 혹, 부스럼, 다수, 수많음
덩어리가 된, 한꺼번의, 일시불의
일괄적으로 취급하다
~을 참다, 견디다
voca.means_en:
A lump of something is a solid piece of it.
A lump on or in someone's body is a small, hard swelling that has been caused by an injury or an illness.
Annie picked up the tiny lump.

Healthiness has become a major selling point.
The comfort of the clothing is a major selling point.
It's a major selling point that celebrities use this product.
Because of this trend, many restaurants are moving toward healthier menus.\n
Nutrition is the process of taking food into the body and absorbing the nutrients in those foods.\n
The nutritional content of food is all the substances that are in it which help you to remain healthy\nPlus, some restaurants also write down the nutritional information of each dish.\n

If people promote something, they help or encourage it to happen, increase, or spread.
If a firm promotes a product, it tries to increase the sales or popularity of that product.
If someone is promoted, they are given a more important job or rank in the organization that they work for.
If a team that competes in a league is promoted, it starts competing in a higher division in the next season because it was one of the most successful teams in the lower division.

Restaurants promote the health benefits of their dishes.
The doctor promoted the health benefits of the treatment.
My mom promotes the health benefits of eating at home.

보통의, 평상시의, 일반적인, 평범한
(모양이) 균형잡힌, 정규의
단골손님, 고정 고객
voca.means_en:
Regular events have equal amounts of time between them, so that they happen, for example, at the same time each day or each week.
Regular events happen often.
If you are, for example, a regular customer at a shop or a regular visitor to a place, you go there often.
You use regular when referring to the thing, person, time, or place that is usually used by someone. For example, someone's regular place is the place where they usually sit.
A regular rhythm consists of a series of sounds or movements with equal periods of time between them.
In some restaurants, a regular drink or quantity of food is of medium size.

voca.means_ko:

물수제비를 뜨다
가볍게 뜀, 생략
voca.means_en:
If you skip along, you move almost as if you are dancing, with a series of little jumps from one foot to the other.
When someone skips, they jump up and down over a rope which they or two other people are holding at each end and turning round and round. In American English, you say that someone skips rope.
If you skip something that you usually do or something that most people do, you decide not to do it.
If you skip or skip over a part of something you are reading or a story you are telling, you miss it out or pass over it quickly and move on to something else.
If you skip from one subject or activity to another, you move quickly from one to the other although there is no obvious connection between them.
A skip is a large, open, metal container which is used to hold and take away large unwanted items and rubbish.
in AM, use dumpster

voca.means_ko:
[s^삘]
흐르다, 쏟아지다, 흘리다, 
엎지르다, 흘리다, 쏟다, 내던지다
엎지르기, 유출, 유출물, 불쏘시개, 기다란 성냥
voca.means_en:
If a liquid spills or if you spill it, it accidentally flows over the edge of a container.
If the contents of a bag, box, or other container spill or are spilled, they come out of the container onto a surface.
If people or things spill out of a place, they come out of it in large numbers.
A spill is an amount of liquid that has spilled from a container.
Annie moved very carefully to keep from spilling the water in the cup.

voca.means_ko: [st^뤠잇은]\n똑바르게 되다/하다, 자세를 바로 하다\n~을 곧게/바르게 하다, ~을 정리하다
voca.means_en:
If you straighten something, you make it tidy or put it in its proper position.
If you are standing in a relaxed or slightly bent position and then you straighten, you make your back or body straight and upright.
If you straighten something, or it straightens, it becomes straight.

voca.means_ko: [st^로울러r]\n거니는 사람, 산책하는 사람,\n어슬렁거리는 사람, 방랑자, 순회 공연자
voca.means_en: A stroller is a small chair on wheels, in which a baby or small child can sit and be wheeled around.\nin BRIT, use pushchair\n

voca.means_ko:
[^슈거r]
설탕, 
(커피 등에 넣는) 설탕 한 숫가락/개
당분, 당, 
여보, 자기(좋아하거나 사랑하는 사람에 대한 호칭)
설탕을 넣다/뿌리다/입히다
voca.means_en:
Sugar is a sweet substance that is used to make food and drinks sweet. It is usually in the form of small white or brown crystals.
If someone has one sugar in their tea or coffee, they have one small spoon of sugar or one sugar lump in it.
Sugars are substances that occur naturally in food. When you eat them, the body converts them into energy.
If you sugar food or drink, you add sugar to it.

If you say that food, especially savoury food, is tasty, you mean that it has a fairly strong and pleasant flavour which makes it good to eat.\nIn the past, restaurants did everything they could to make the food taste good. They used a lot of sugar and artificial seasoning. A lot of the dishes were tasty but unhealthy.\n

voca.means_ko:
[언^헬씌]
건강하지 못한, 건강하지 않아 보이는, 병든 것 같은
건강에 해로운, 유해한
비정상적인, 불건전한
voca.means_en:
Something that is unhealthy is likely to cause illness or poor health.
If you are unhealthy, you are not very fit or well.
An unhealthy economy or company is financially weak and unsuccessful.
If you describe someone's behaviour or interests as unhealthy, you do not consider them to be normal and think they may involve mental problems.

If you describe something or someone as weird, you mean that they are strange.
Listen - that weird sound.
Don't worry about it being weird.
He heard weird gurgling sound s behind them.
"You sure are acting weird."

voca.means_ko:
[^륑끌]
(특히 얼굴위) 주름, (옷, 종이 등에 생긴) 주름/구김살
~에 주름을 잡다, 주름이 지다
찡그리다
voca.means_en:
Wrinkles are lines which form on someone's face as they grow old.
A wrinkle is a raised fold in a piece of cloth or paper that spoils its appearance.
When someone's skin wrinkles or when something wrinkles it, lines start to form in it because the skin is getting old or damaged.
If cloth wrinkles, or if someone or something wrinkles it, it gets folds or lines in it.
When you wrinkle your nose or forehead, or when it wrinkles, you tighten the muscles in your face so that the skin folds.

voca.means_ko: (특히 기억하거나 기록하기 위해) ~을 적다\n(회계 장부에서) ~을 감가상각하다
voca.means_en:
to write something on paper so that you do not forget it
to reduce the value of what a company owns when stating it in the company's accounts
Plus, some restaurants also write down the nutritional information of each dish.

An accountant is a person whose job is to keep financial accounts.
What time is the accountant coming?
If you need an accountant, my brother could help you out.

The employee was of no help.
This map is of no help.
The manual was of no help.

voca.means_ko:
[비^하인d]
(위치가) 뒤에, 뒤의, 후방의
(어떤 사람의) 과거에
뒤에 숨은, 배후의
~의 뒤쪽에, 늦어서, 과거에, 숨겨진
voca.means_en:
at the back / at the rear / behind
Your behind is the part of your body that you sit on.
If something is behind a thing or person, it is on the other side of them from you, or nearer their back rather than their front.
If you stay behind, you remain in a place after other people have gone.
When you shut a door or gate behind you, you shut it after you have gone through it.

honest / frank / direct / open / outspoken / straight / blunt
If you are blunt, you say exactly what you think without trying to be polite.
A blunt object has a rounded or flat end rather than a sharp one.
A blunt knife or blade is no longer sharp and does not cut well.
If something blunts an emotion, a feeling or a need, it weakens it.

to meet somebody by chance
to hit somebody/something by accident
The good news was that D.W. suddenly stopped singing. The bad news was that she stopped because she had bumped into her mother.

voca.means_ko:
[컴퍼^지션]

(음악, 미술, 시) 작품
작곡, 작성, 작곡법
(학교에서 하는) 작문, 짧은 에세이
(그림, 사진의) 구도
voca.means_en:
structure / framework / composition / construction / fabric / make-up
When you talk about the composition of something, you are referring to the way in which its various parts are put together and arranged.
The compositions of a composer, painter, or other artist are the works of art that they have produced.
A composition is a piece of written work that children write at school.
Composition is the technique or skill involved in creating a work of art.

Compost is a mixture of decayed plants and vegetable waste which is added to the soil to help plants grow.
Compost is specially treated soil that you buy and use to grow seeds and plants in pots.
To compost things such as unwanted bits of plants means to make them into compost.

복합체, 혼합물, 복합적인 요소, 화합물

악화시키다, 더 심각하게 만들다

섞다, 혼합하다.

합성의,  혼합/복합의
voca.means_en:
A compound is an enclosed area of land that is used for a particular purpose.
In chemistry, a compound is a substance that consists of two or more elements.
If something is a compound of different things, it consists of those things.
Compound is used to indicate that something consists of two or more parts or things.
In grammar, a compound sentence is one that is made up of two or more main clauses. Compare complex.
To compound a problem, difficulty, or mistake means to make it worse by adding to it.
the ability to be compressed\nsymbol k the reciprocal of the bulk modulus; the ratio of volume strain to stress at constant temperature\n
If you cringe at something, you feel embarrassed or disgusted, and perhaps show this feeling in your expression or by making a slight movement.\n
A department store is a large shop which sells many different kinds of goods.\nI recently went to a department store to shop for some shoes.\n

(정도, 일상 등으로부터) 벗어남, 일탈
voca.means_en:
Departure or a departure is the act of going away from somewhere.
The departure of a person from a job, or a member from an organization, is their act of leaving it or being forced to leave it.
If someone does something different or unusual, you can refer to their action as a departure.

(구형 전화기의) 다이얼
다이얼을 돌리다, 전화를 걸다
voca.means_en:
A dial is the part of a machine or instrument such as a clock or watch which shows you the time or a measurement that has been recorded.
A dial is a control on a device or piece of equipment which you can move in order to adjust the setting, for example to select or change the frequency on a radio or the temperature of a heater.
On some telephones, especially older ones, the dial is the disc on the front that you turn with your finger to choose the number that you want to call. The disc has holes in it, and numbers or letters behind the holes.
If you dial or if you dial a number, you turn the dial or press the buttons on a telephone in order to phone someone.
Mrs. Read picked up the phone and dialed a number. She left a message with the secretary.

An electronic device has transistors or silicon chips which control and change the electric current passing through the device.\nAn electronic process or activity involves the use of electronic devices.\n
When something such as a contract, deadline, or visa expires, it comes to an end or is no longer valid.\n

안절부절못하다, 조바심내다
voca.means_en: If you fidget, you keep moving your hands or feet slightly or changing your position slightly, for example because you are nervous, bored, or excited.\nIf you fidget with something, you keep moving it or touching it with your fingers with small movements, for example because you are nervous or bored.\n

voca.means_ko:
[^포r-k]
포크, 쇠스랑, 갈퀴
(도로, 강 등의) 분기점/갈래
갈라지다, 나뉘다, 
(갈림길 등에서 오른쪽, 왼쪽) 길로 가다
voca.means_en:
A fork is a tool used for eating food which has a row of three or four long metal points at the end.
A garden fork is a tool used for breaking up soil which has a row of three or four long metal points at the end.
A fork in a road, path, or river is a point at which it divides into two parts and forms a 'Y' shape.
If you fork food into your mouth or onto a plate, you put it there using a fork.
If a road, path, or river forks, it forms a fork.

voca.means_ko:

지치게 하다, 지치다
(너덜너덜) 닳아 해어짐, 조각자고(으로 해어진 것)
기진맥진(한 상태)
voca.means_en:
to make or become exhausted or weary; tire out
the state of being frazzled or exhausted
a frayed end or remnant
to a frazzle absolutely; completely (esp in the phrase burnt to a frazzle)
Mrs. Read was an accountant. She always got a little frazzled at tax time. \n
None of the employees offered to help me. I finally got a hold of an employee and asked him some questions.\n
When I tried them on at home, they did not fit me. They were too tight. I went back to the store to get a refund.\n

voca.means_ko: [글^렌s]\n흘끗 보다, 대충 훑어 보다, (빛이) 번득이다\n일견, 힐끗 보기, 번득임, 섬광
voca.means_en:
look / glance / gaze / stare / glimpse / glare
If you glance at something or someone, you look at them very quickly and then look away again immediately.
If you glance through or at a newspaper, report, or book, you spend a short time looking at it without reading it very carefully.
A glance is a quick look at someone or something.
Jack glanced around. / He glanced around the tree house.
Then Jack glanced back at the cliff.

voca.means_ko:
[^어니s들릐]
솔직히, 
(사실임을 강조하여) 정말로, 진짜로
정말, 참으로 (맘에 안 들거나 짜증스러움을 나타냄)
voca.means_en:
You use honestly to emphasize that you are referring to your, or someone else's, true beliefs or feelings.
You use honestly to emphasize that you are telling the truth and that you want people to believe you.
You use honestly to indicate that you are annoyed or impatient.
Honesty is the quality of being honest.\n

You say 'Hush!' to someone when you are asking or telling them to be quiet.
If you hush someone or if they hush, they stop speaking or making a noise.
You say there is a hush in a place when everything is quiet and peaceful, or suddenly becomes quiet.
In the hush of the cold twilight, the dove spread its wings and flew into the Frog Creek woods.
"Just as I feared," said Teddy in a hushed voice.
A hush fell over the room.
"Hush, Arthur!" said his mother. "Not now, D.W. I've got a few calls to make."

voca.means_ko: [인^헤뤼튼s]\n상속받은 재산, 유산, 상속\n(과거, 선대로부터 몰려받은) 유산, 유전(되는 것)
voca.means_en:
An inheritance is money or property which you receive from someone who has died.
If you get something such as job, problem, or attitude from someone who used to have it, you can refer to this as an inheritance.
Your inheritance is the particular characteristics or qualities which your family or ancestors had and which you are born with.

voca.means_ko:
[이^닛쉬에잇t]
개시되게 하다, 착수시키다
(~가 ~을 처음으로) 접하게 하다
(특히 비밀 의식을 통해) 가입/입회시키다
시작하다, 개시하다, 원리를 가르치다
voca.means_en:
If you initiate something, you start it or cause it to happen.
If you initiate someone into something, you introduce them to a particular skill or type of knowledge and teach them about it.
If someone is initiated into something such as a religion, secret society, or social group, they become a member of it by taking part in ceremonies at which they learn its special knowledge or customs.

A knife is a tool for cutting or a weapon and consists of a flat piece of metal with a sharp edge on the end of a handle.
A surgeon's knife is a piece of equipment used to cut flesh and organs during operations. It is made of metal and has a very thin sharp edge.
To knife someone means to attack and injure them with a knife.
If someone does something like a knife through butter or like a hot knife through butter, they do it very easily.
If you have been in a place where there was a very tense atmosphere, you can say that you could have cut the atmosphere with a knife.
If a lot of people want something unpleasant to happen to someone, for example if they want them to lose their job, you can say that the knives are out for that person.
If you twist the knife or if you turn the knife in someone's wound, you do or say something to make an unpleasant situation they are in even more unpleasant.

voca.means_ko:
[^노우]
알다, 알고있다
알게 되다, 깨닫다, 이해/의식하다
알다, 확신하다
~을 ~과 구별하다

voca.means_en:
If you know a fact, a piece of information, or an answer, you have it correctly in your mind.
If you know someone, you are familiar with them because you have met them and talked to them before.
If you say that you know of something, you mean that you have heard about it but you do not necessarily have a lot of information about it.
If you know about a subject, you have studied it or taken an interest in it, and understand part or all of it.
If you know a language, you have learned it and can understand it.
If you know something such as a place, a work of art, or an idea, you have visited it, seen it, read it, or heard about it, and so you are familiar with it.
If you know how to do something, you have the necessary skills and knowledge to do it.
You can say that someone knows that something is happening when they become aware of it.
None of the employees offered to help me. I finally got a hold of an employee and asked him some questions. However, he knew nothing about the items in the store.\n

Someone or something that is quick moves or does things with great speed.
Something that is quick takes or lasts only a short time.
Quick means happening without delay or with very little delay.
If you are quick to do something, you do not hesitate to do it.
If someone has a quick temper, they are easily made angry.
Quicker is sometimes used to mean 'at a greater speed', and quickest to mean 'at the greatest speed'. Quick is sometimes used to mean 'with great speed'. Some people consider this to be non-standard.

The store ripped me off.
They might rip you off if you are not careful.
Some stores are known to rip tourists off.

A secretary is a person who is employed to do office work, such as typing letters, answering phone calls, and arranging meetings.

If a shop sells a particular thing, it is available for people to buy there.
If something sells for a particular price, that price is paid for it.
If something sells, it is bought by the public, usually in fairly large quantities.

I went to shop for some shoes.
We have to shop for holiday gifts.
Where do you shop for clothes?

If you have a stock of things, you have a supply of them stored in a place ready to be used.

If a shop stocks particular goods, it keeps a supply of them to sell.

Tight clothes or shoes are rather small and fit closely to your body.
Tight controls or rules are very strict.
Skin, cloth, or string that is tight is stretched or pulled so that it is smooth or straight.
Tight is used to describe a group of things or an amount of something that is closely packed together.
If a part of your body is tight, it feels rather uncomfortable and painful, for example because you are ill, anxious, or angry.
A tight group of people is one whose members are closely linked by beliefs, feelings, or interests.

Traffic refers to all the vehicles that are moving along the roads in a particular area.
Traffic refers to the movement of ships, trains, or aircraft between one place and another. Traffic also refers to the people and goods that are being transported.
Traffic in something such as drugs or stolen goods is an illegal trade in them.
Someone who traffics in something such as drugs or stolen goods buys and sells them even though it is illegal to do so.

Traffic lights are sets of red, amber, and green lights at the places where roads meet. They control the traffic by signalling when vehicles have to stop and when they can go. Traffic lights can also be referred to as a traffic light.\n"Slow down, sweetie. We can't afford to put a traffic light in here."\n

If you have a narrow escape, something unpleasant nearly happens to you.
If something narrows, it becomes less wide.
If your eyes narrow or if you narrow your eyes, you almost close them, for example because you are angry or because you are trying to concentrate on something.

An overall is a piece of clothing shaped like a coat that you wear over your clothes in order to protect them while you are working.
I think all of our guests had a good time. Overall, it was very successful party.

voca.means_ko: [^페쉬지]\n통과, 통로, 구절, 한 단락, 경과, 통행\n나아가다, 가로지르다, 통과하다
voca.means_en:
A passage is a long narrow space with walls or fences on both sides, which connects one place or room with another.
A passage in a book, speech, or piece of music is a section of it that you are considering separately from the rest.
A passage is a long narrow hole or tube in your body, which air or liquid can pass along.
A passage through a crowd of people or things is an empty space that allows you to move through them.
The passage of someone or something is their movement from one place to another.
The passage of someone or something is their progress from one situation or one stage in their development to another.

You use possibly to indicate that you are not sure whether something is true or might happen.
You use possibly to emphasize that you are surprised, puzzled, or shocked by something that you have seen or heard.
You use possibly to emphasize that someone has tried their hardest to do something, or has done it as well as they can.
You use possibly to emphasize that something definitely cannot happen or definitely cannot be done.
Lisa: Can you possibly make it earlier?

voca.means_ko:
[p롸^퍼지션]
(특히 사업상의) 제의
(하려는) 일, (처리해야 할) 문제, 과제
(미국에서 국민투표를 위한) 법률 개정안
명제, 진술
voca.means_en:
If you describe something such as a task or an activity as, for example, a difficult proposition or an attractive proposition, you mean that it is difficult or pleasant to do.
A proposition is a statement or an idea which people can consider or discuss to decide whether it is true.
In the United States, a proposition is a question or statement about an issue of public policy which appears on a voting paper so that people can vote for or against it.
A proposition is an offer or a suggestion that someone makes to you, usually concerning some work or business that you might be able to do together.
If someone who you do not know very well propositions you, they suggest that you have sex with them.

half / whole / quarter
A quarter is one of four equal parts of something.
A quarter is a fixed period of three months. Companies often divide their financial year into four quarters.
When you are telling the time, you use quarter to talk about the fifteen minutes before or after an hour. For example, 8.15 is quarter past eight, and 8.45 is quarter to nine. In American English, you can also say that 8.15 is a quarter after eight and 8.45 is a quarter of nine.
A quarter is an American or Canadian coin that is worth 25 cents.
If you quarter something such as a fruit or a vegetable, you cut it into four roughly equal parts.
If the number or size of something is quartered, it is reduced to about a quarter of its previous number or size.
If you do something at close quarters, you do it very near to a particular person or thing.
Lisa: I want to get a general checkup.\n

voca.means_ko: [^뤤t]\n(사용료를 내고 단기간) 빌리다, 임대하다, 빌려주다\n집세, 방세, 임대료
voca.means_en:
rent / hire / let / rate / charge / fee / rent / dues / toll / rental / tariff
If you rent something, you regularly pay its owner a sum of money in order to be able to have it and use it yourself.
If you rent something to someone, you let them have it and use it in exchange for a sum of money which they pay you regularly.
Rent is the amount of money that you pay regularly to use a house, flat, or piece of land.
A : You are right. The rent is affordable but my neighbors are just annoying. They party all the time!
If one thing or person resembles another, they are similar to each other.\n
Assistant: Do you want to book it as a roundtrip ticket?\n

agenda / diary / schedule / timetable
A schedule is a plan that gives a list of events or tasks and the times at which each one should happen or be done.
You can use schedule to refer to the time or way something is planned to be done. For example, if something is completed on schedule, it is completed at the time planned.
A schedule is a written list of things, for example a list of prices, details, or conditions.
A schedule is a list of all the times when trains, boats, buses, or aircraft are supposed to arrive at or leave a particular place.
In a school or college, a schedule is a diagram that shows the times in the week at which particular subjects are taught.
If something is scheduled to happen at a particular time, arrangements are made for it to happen at that time.
Lisa: Hi, I would like to schedule an appointment with Dr. Kingston, please.\n
Your allergy is nothing to sneeze at.\nShe is nothing to sneeze at.\n

If you specify something, you give information about what is required or should happen in a certain situation.\nIf you specify what should happen or be done, you explain it in an exact and detailed way.\n

voca.means_ko: [s^빽테이러r]\n관중, 관객, 구경꾼, 방관자\n(특히 스포츠 행사의) 관중
voca.means_en: witness / audience / viewer / observer / spectator / onlooker / passer-by / bystander / eyewitness\nA spectator is someone who watches something, especially a sporting event.\n

voca.means_ko:
[s^빠익k]
못, 대못, 뾰족한 것
못을 박다, 찌르다, (누구의 말, 글을) 거부하다
(가치가) 급등하다
voca.means_en:
A spike is a long piece of metal with a sharp point.
Any long pointed object can be referred to as a spike.
If there is a spike in the price, volume, or amount of something, the price, volume, or amount of it suddenly increases.
Spikes are a pair of sports shoes with pointed pieces of metal attached to the soles. They help runners' feet to grip the ground when they are running.
You are the spitting image of your mother.\n

voca.means_ko:
[st^롸-이d]
성큼성큼 걷다
(성큼성큼 걷는) 걸음/발 걸음
걸음걸이, 달리는 모습, 달음박질
진전
voca.means_en:
stride - strode - stridden
If you stride somewhere, you walk there with quick, long steps.
A stride is a long step which you take when you are walking or running.
Someone's stride is their way of walking with long steps.
If you make strides in something that you are doing, you make rapid progress in it.
If you get into your stride or hit your stride, you start to do something easily and confidently, after being slow and uncertain.
In British English, if you take a problem or difficulty in your stride, you deal with it calmly and easily. The American expression is take something in stride.
But he galloped on - not even breaking his stride as he started up a rocky slope.
Then she and Jack squeezed through the narrow crack and strode through the bright crystal cave.
California is making massive strides just in a few months.

voca.means_ko: [^테이st]\n미각, 맛, 취향, 입맛, 기호, 취향\n맛보다, 맛을 느끼다, ~ 맛이 나다
voca.means_en:
Taste is one of the five senses that people have. When you have food or drink in your mouth, your sense of taste makes it possible for you to recognize what it is.
The taste of something is the individual quality which it has when you put it in your mouth and which distinguishes it from other things. For example, something may have a sweet, bitter, sour, or salty taste.
If you have a taste of some food or drink, you try a small amount of it in order to see what the flavour is like.
If you have a taste of a particular way of life or activity, you have a brief experience of it.
A person's taste is their choice in the things that they like or buy, for example their clothes, possessions, or music. If you say that someone has good taste, you mean that you approve of their choices. If you say that they have poor taste, you disapprove of their choices.
If food or drink tastes of something, it has that particular flavour, which you notice when you eat or drink it.

The food tasted extra good.
Food always tastes extra good after exercising.
The water tasted extra good because I was thirsty.

Taxation is the system by which a government takes money from people and spends it on things such as education, health, and defence.\nTaxation is the amount of money that people have to pay in taxes.\n
Someone's uncle is the brother of their mother or father, or the husband of their aunt.\n
to remove an obstruction from (a drain, etc)\n

If you are uncomfortable, you are slightly worried or embarrassed, and not relaxed and confident.
Something that is uncomfortable makes you feel slight pain or physical discomfort when you experience it or use it.
If you are uncomfortable, you are not physically content and relaxed, and feel slight pain or discomfort.
You can describe a situation or fact as uncomfortable when it is difficult to deal with and causes problems and worries.
Jason: I'm just looking for something very comfortable.
Waitress: Under which name did you make a reservation?\nJason: Ah! It should be under my girl friend's name not mine. Lisa Smith.\n

voca.means_ko: [^웨이쥐]\n(보통 주 단위로 받는)임금, 급료\n(전쟁, 전투 등을) 벌이다, 계속하다
voca.means_en:
income / wage / wages / pay / salary / earnings
Someone's wages are the amount of money that is regularly paid to them for the work that they do.
If a person, group, or country wages a campaign or a war, they start it and continue it over a period of time.
A wagtail is a type of small bird which moves its tail quickly up and down as it walks.\n

Your waist is the middle part of your body where it narrows slightly above your hips.
The waist of a garment such as a dress, coat, or pair of trousers is the part of it which covers the middle part of your body.
It went up to the short ninja's waist.

voca.means_ko:
[^웨잇t]
기다리다
(바라는 일이 이루어지기를, 특히 오랫동안) 기다리다
(사람이 사용하거나 갖도록) 기다리다, 대기하다
(긴급하지 않으므로) 미뤄지다
기다리기, 기다림, 기다리는 시간
voca.means_en:
When you wait for something or someone, you spend some time doing very little, because you cannot act until that thing happens or that person arrives.
If something is waiting for you, it is ready for you to use, have, or do.
If you say that something can wait, you mean that it is not important or urgent and so you will deal with it or do it later.
You can use wait when you are trying to make someone feel excited, or to encourage or threaten them.
Wait is used in expressions such as wait a minute, wait a second, and wait a moment to interrupt someone when they are speaking, for example because you object to what they are saying or because you want them to repeat something.
If an employee waits on you, for example in a restaurant or hotel, they take orders from you and bring you what you want.
A wait is a period of time in which you do very little, before something happens or before you can do something.
If you say that you can't wait to do something or can hardly wait to do it, you are emphasizing that you are very excited about it and eager to do it.
If you tell someone to wait and see, you tell them that they must be patient or that they must not worry about what is going to happen in the future because they have no control over it.
I will wait for your call.\n

voca.means_ko: [^웨이버r]\n(지불 의무 등의) 면제, 포기, 포기증서\n(권리 등의) 포기, 포기 서류
voca.means_en: A waiver is when a person, government, or organization agrees to give up a right or says that people do not have to obey a particular rule or law.\n

Young people easily adapt to new trends.
She is very good at adapting to new trends.
I don't think I'm good at adapting to new trends.

We went to the fast food place after class.
I went home right after class.
What do you want to do after class?
altogether / all together\nAssistant: OK, that's not a problem. It's $120 all together.\n
My family's house is in a large apartment complex.\n

If you arrange an event or meeting, you make plans for it to happen.
If you arrange with someone to do something, you make plans with them to do it.
If you arrange something for someone, you make it possible for them to have it or to do it.
If you arrange things somewhere, you place them in a particular position, usually in order to make them look attractive or tidy.
If a piece of music is arranged by someone, it is changed or adapted so that it is suitable for particular instruments or voices, or for a particular performance.
She carefully arranged the folds around them.
considered as one general group\nThe biggest change was that we expanded the living room out to the balcony. This made the house feel more spacious as a whole.\n
At the moment, I don't have any cash on me.\nSecretary: I'm sorry, he's out of the office at the moment.\n

Your attitude to something is the way that you think and feel about it,
If you refer to someone as a person with attitude, you mean that they have a striking and individual style of behaviour, especially a forceful or aggressive one.
It's not a matter of age. It's more about attitude.

A balcony is a platform on the outside of a building, above ground level, with a wall or railing around it.
The balcony in a theatre or cinema is an area of seats above the main seating area.
Other rooms in the apartment are the living room, the kitchen, the bathroom, the storage closet, and the balcony.

It was a big deal to go to the fast food place when I was young.
It seems like it is a big deal now, but it won't later.
These days, finding a jo is a big deal.

We were regulars at the fast food place.
He knew what we wanted, because we are regulars.
The food here is so good, I want to be a regular.

B : I'm disappointed with the movie. I mean, the story somewhat bizarre.
I'm disappointed with you.
He was disappointed with last month's profits.
I was very disappointed with myself.

When the work was finished, the apartment looked brand new. I was very happy with the new look.
I am happy with the results.
I hope you are happy with the outcome.
The walls were missing something, so I bought some framed paintings and put them up.\n

voca.means_ko: 어찌할줄을 모르다, 어쩔 줄 모르다, \n주체를 못하다
voca.means_en: No. I'm really overwhelmed with a heavy workload. \n
Yeah! I'm sure they will be shocked with your surprising luck.\n
But how the heck are we supposed to do that?\nB : Sure, but weren't you supposed to get a report card sometime this week? \n
used for suggesting that something is not as important or impressive as somebody else thinks it is\n

Something that is bizarre is very odd and strange.
Staring at the bizarre creature, Jack remembered the story of the Raven King-how the king had wanted to be a bird, how he had stolen a spell from the Wizard of Winter, how the spell had worked only halfway and left him half bird and half human.
B : I'm disappointed with the movie. I mean, the story somewhat bizarre.

voca.means_ko:
[b^뤤d]
상표, 브랜드
(특정한) 종류, 유형
(동물의 주인을 나타내는) 낙인
(특히 부당하게) 낙인을 찍다
(동물에게 주인을 표시하는) 낙인을 찍다
voca.means_en:
A brand of a product is the version of it that is made by one particular manufacturer.
A brand of something such as a way of thinking or behaving is a particular kind of it.
If someone is branded as something bad, people think they are that thing.
When you brand an animal, you put a permanent mark on its skin in order to show who it belongs to, usually by burning a mark onto its skin.
A brand-new object is completely new.\n
Assistant: Yes, I'll let you know if there's a cancellation.\n

In British English, to cater for a group of people means to provide all the things that they need or want. In American English, you say you cater to a person or group of people.\nIn British English, to cater for something means to take it into account. In American English, you say you cater to something.\n

voca.means_ko: [^췹-p]\n(값이) 싼, 저렴한, 싸구려의, 싸게, \n천박한, 저질스러운, 하찮은
voca.means_en:
cheap / competitive / budget / affordable / reasonable / inexpensive
Goods or services that are cheap cost less money than usual or than you expected.
If you describe goods as cheap, you mean they cost less money than similar products but their quality is poor.
If you describe someone's remarks or actions as cheap, you mean that they are unkindly or insincerely using a situation to benefit themselves or to harm someone else.
If you describe someone as cheap, you are criticizing them for being unwilling to spend money.
If someone does or buys something on the cheap, they spend less money than they should because they are more concerned with what it costs than with its quality.
Seller: It will be $140 all together. It's very cheap.

voca.means_ko: (~을 들먹이며 대화에) 끼어들다, 합류하다\n(돈을) 각출하다, 조금씩 내다
voca.means_en:
to join in or interrupt a conversation; to add something to a conversation
to give some money so that a group of people can buy something together
How about getting a bottle of champagne? I'll chip-in a few extra dollars.
Concurrent events or situations happen at the same time.\n

voca.means_ko:
[컨^딧션]
상태, 조건, 상황, 날씨
(치유가 안 되는 만성) 질환, 문제
(생활, 작업 등의) 환경, 상황
(물리적) 환경, (특정 시기의) 날씨
(요구) 조건
길들이다, 훈련시키다, 
좌우하다, 영향을 미치다
voca.means_en:
condition / state
If you talk about the condition of a person or thing, you are talking about the state that they are in, especially how good or bad their physical state is.
The conditions under which something is done or happens are all the factors or circumstances which directly affect it.
The conditions in which people live or work are the factors which affect their comfort, safety, or health.
A condition is something which must happen or be done in order for something else to be possible, especially when this is written into a contract or law.
If someone has a particular condition, they have an illness or other medical problem.
To condition your hair or skin means to put something on it which will keep it in good condition.
If you say that someone is in no condition to do something, you mean that they are too ill, upset, or drunk to do it.
When you agree to do something on condition that something else happens, you mean that you will only do it if this other thing also happens.
If someone is conditioned by their experiences or environment, they are influenced by them over a period of time so that they do certain things or think in a particular way.

If a situation or agreement is conditional on something, it will only happen or continue if this thing happens.\nIn grammar, a conditional clause is a subordinate clause which refers to a situation which may exist or whose possible consequences you are considering. Most conditional clauses begin with 'if' or 'unless', for example 'If that happens, we'll be in big trouble' and 'You don't have to come unless you want to'.\n

voca.means_ko:
[컨^덕-t]
(특정한 활동을) 하다, 지휘하다
(어떤 장소를 이리저리) 안내하다
행동하다, 처신하다
(열이나 전기를) 전도하다
(특정한 장소나 상황에서의) 행동
경영, 수행, 처리
voca.means_en:
When you conduct an activity or task, you organize it and carry it out.
If you conduct yourself in a particular way, you behave in that way.
When someone conducts an orchestra or choir, they stand in front of it and direct its performance.
If something conducts heat or electricity, it allows heat or electricity to pass through it or along it.
The conduct of a task or activity is the way in which it is organized and carried out.
Someone's conduct is the way they behave in particular situations.

voca.means_ko:
[큰^덕터r]
(합창, 합주의) 지휘자
여행 안내원
(버스나 기차의) 안내원, 승무원
(전기나 열의) 전도체
voca.means_en:
A conductor is a person who stands in front of an orchestra or choir and directs its performance.
On a bus, the conductor is the person whose job is to sell tickets to the passengers.
On a train, a conductor is a person whose job is to travel on the train in order to help passengers and check tickets.
A conductor is a substance that heat or electricity can pass through or along.

For drinks, I've tried to cut back on sodas. I try to drink a lot of water instead.
He has cut back on smoking.
She had to cut back on her naps.

voca.means_ko:
[^도온]
새벽, 여명, 동이 틀 무렵, 시작, 시초
(날이)새다, 밝아오다
분명해지다, 이해가 되기 시작하다
voca.means_en:
Dawn is the time of day when light first appears in the sky, just before the sun rises.
The dawn of a period of time or a situation is the beginning of it.
If something is dawning, it is beginning to develop or come into existence.
When you say that a particular day dawned, you mean it arrived or began, usually when it became light.
Jason: Cool, let's drink till dawn.

A defect is a fault or imperfection in a person or thing.
If you defect, you leave your country, political party, or other group, and join an opposing country, party, or group.
Lisa: Here is the receipt. I couldn't find any defects when I bought it.
If something is defective, there is something wrong with it and it does not work properly.\n"Defective means broken, right?" said Annie.\n

If you defend someone or something, you take action in order to protect them.
If you defend someone or something when they have been criticized, you argue in support of them.
When a lawyer defends a person who has been accused of something, the lawyer argues on their behalf in a court of law that the charges are not true.
When a sports player plays in the tournament which they won the previous time it was held, you can say that they are defending their title.
A defendant is a person who has been accused of breaking the law and is being tried in court.\n

If you defer an event or action, you arrange for it to happen at a later date, rather than immediately or at the previously planned time.\nIf you defer to someone, you accept their opinion or do what they want you to do, even when you do not agree with it yourself, because you respect them or their authority.\n
to accept somebody's opinion or do what they suggest because you respect them\n
to accept somebody's opinion or do what they suggest because you respect them\n
People go tenting there, and have barbecues in designated areas. It's a great place to enjoy the breeze and a fun place to go people-watching.\n

hate / dislike / can't stand / despise / can't bear / loathe / detest
If you dislike someone or something, you consider them to be unpleasant and do not like them.
Dislike is the feeling that you do not like someone or something.
Your dislikes are the things that you do not like.
If you take a dislike to someone or something, you decide that you do not like them.
For the food, we cooked some dishes ourselves. My wife and I both enjoy cooking, so we didn't mind.\n

voca.means_ko:
[^덤블륑]
덤플링(고기 요리에 넣어 먹는 새알심)
(흔히 안에 과일이 든 디저트용) 경단
만두
voca.means_en: Dumplings are small lumps of dough that are cooked and eaten, either with meat and vegetables or as part of a sweet pudding.\nThe owner knew us well, because we were regulars. She used to give us free dumplings sometimes.\n
